</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our principal executive offices are located at No. 5 New Square, Bedfont Lakes Business Park, Feltham,
	Middlesex, TW14 8HA, our telephone number is +(44) 208 918 3200 and our fax number is +(44) 208 918 3491.&nbsp;Our registered office is located at Nemours Chambers, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands and its telephone number is (284)
	852-7900.&nbsp;Our registered agent in the United States is c/o Mariposa Capital, LLC, 5200 Blue Lagoon Drive, Suite 855, Miami, FL 33126.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	See
<I>
	Item 5B: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources
</I>
	for information regarding our capital expenditures for the past three fiscal years and principal capital expenditures currently in progress.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Business Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Our Company
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are the leading manufacturer and distributor of branded frozen foods in Western Europe based on net sales value. Our products are sold primarily
	through large grocery retailers under the brand &#147;
<I>
	Birds Eye
</I>
	&#148; in the United Kingdom and Ireland, &#147;
<I>
	Findus
</I>
	&#148; in Italy, San Marino, France, Spain and Scandinavia and &#147;
<I>
	Iglo
</I>
	&#148; in Germany and other
	continental markets. According to Euromonitor, our share of the frozen food market (excluding ice cream) in Western Europe stood at 13.9% in 2015 (2.7 times greater than the nearest competitor) with leadership positions in the United Kingdom, Italy,
	Spain, Portugal, France, Belgium, Austria, Sweden, Germany and Hungary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Our Strategy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We intend to grow our business profitably and create shareholder value through the following strategic initiatives:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Build an integrated group of best-in-class food companies and brands within existing and related food categories and expand our geographic footprint through
	strategic acquisitions.
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our goal is to transform our company into an integrated best-in-class, global manufacturer, marketer and
	distributor of food products, within and outside of the frozen food category and the broader food sector.&nbsp;We believe there are significant growth opportunities in the European and North American markets and that the Iglo Acquisition and the
	Findus Acquisition provide a strong platform on which to grow our business and expand and enhance our market share in the food industry in key geographic markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Leverage our acquisition expertise, strong management team and access to capital to identify and evaluate attractive growth opportunities.
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our Founders and CEO have significant experience and expertise, and have been highly successful, in identifying, acquiring and integrating value-added
	businesses.&nbsp;We believe that this expertise, our access to capital and the deep industry knowledge of our management team will position us to acquire related and complimentary food businesses that can enhance our market position, create
	synergies and fully leverage our existing marketing, manufacturing and supply chain capabilities, which we believe will allow us to deliver sustained profitable growth and maximize shareholder value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Aligning our business with consumer preferences.
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our
	goal is to create and acquire food businesses and brands that strongly align with consumer needs and preferences, that have high growth and margin potential and that leverage our existing portfolio of brands.&nbsp;For example, in order to fully
	leverage the value of our Findus brand, which we owned in Italy, we acquired the
<I>
	Findus
</I>
	,
<I>
	Lutosa
</I>
	and
<I>
	La Cocinera
</I>
	brands in their respective markets.&nbsp;We believe the Findus Acquisition will allow us to consolidate and expand
	this well-known and highly regarded brand and to maximize the returns on our portfolio of products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	28
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Our Competitive Strengths
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We believe the following competitive strengths differentiate us from our competitors and contribute to our ongoing success.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Market leader with solid European platform and strong acquisition opportunities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As the leading branded frozen food producer in Western Europe based on net sales value, we benefit from economies of scale and have developed a strong
	platform for our products throughout Europe.&nbsp;We believe our strong existing platforms facilitate our expansion within a large addressable market and provide a broad set of potential acquisition targets in various food categories and geographic
	markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Experienced management team and Board with a proven track record
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our management team has extensive experience in the food industry and other fast moving consumer goods markets.&nbsp;Our management team is complemented
	by an experienced Board of Directors, which includes several individuals with a proven track record of successfully acquiring and managing consumer businesses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Effective brand equity strategy to leverage and expand well-known brands
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our brands are household names with long histories and local heritage in their respective markets. We centralize our marketing efforts to ensure that we
	fully leverage the goodwill of our existing brands, that our brand positioning strategy aligns with consumer preferences and that we create high impact marketing programs that build brand awareness and loyalty. We focus on our local hero platforms
	that are designed to restore local iconic assets such as &#147;the Captain&#148;. We intend to prioritize our marketing resources on our &#147;must win battles&#148; in each market in which we operate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Commitment to innovation and research and development
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We focus our efforts on renovation of core products and our investment in market research on our &#147;must win battles&#148; to ensure that the
	products we launch overcome penetration barriers. In order to ensure the development and introduction of products that fit this criteria, we have implemented a structured process through which we take new products from idea generation, through
	concept screening, concept/products laboratories and early volume sizing, to final validation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Our Business
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are the leading branded frozen food producer in Western Europe in terms of net sales value. We have leading market share in the fish and vegetables
	industry market segments in our key markets (the United Kingdom, Italy, Germany, Sweden, France and Norway) and in several other markets across Europe, including Austria, Belgium, Spain, The Netherlands, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Portugal
	and Switzerland. For a description of the principal markets in which we compete and related revenue, see Note 5 &#147;Segment reporting&#148; to our audited consolidated financial statements which appear elsewhere in this annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our brands are household names with long histories and local heritage in their respective markets.&nbsp;We have an efficient and centralized supply
	chain which is closely aligned with our geographic footprint, allowing us to optimize our supply arrangements and reduce distribution costs.&nbsp;We operate ten manufacturing plants, one in the United Kingdom, two in Germany, two in Norway, two in
	Sweden, one in Italy, one in France and one in Spain.&nbsp;We manufacture most of our products but outsource certain manufacturing processes, such as the processing of certain vegetables as well as most complete meal products.&nbsp;In addition, our
	distribution function is largely outsourced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	29
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Our Brands
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our
	Birds Eye brand is marketed in the United Kingdom and Ireland, Findus is marketed in Italy, France, Spain and Scandinavia and Iglo is marketed in Germany and other continental European countries. Under these brands we manufacture and market frozen
	food products such as fish, vegetables, poultry and ready meals. Pursuant to our focus on our core &#147;must win battles&#148;, we will advertise these, leveraging our local iconic brand assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Customers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our customers are typically supermarkets and
	large food retail chains supplying food products directly to consumers.&nbsp;Each key market in which we operate has its own distinct retail landscape.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The majority of our sales are to traditional retailers and we expect this channel to remain our most significant channel for the foreseeable
	future.&nbsp;We partner with traditional retailers when we identify commercial or marketing opportunities that can be of interest for both businesses.&nbsp;We continue to review the presence and impact of the discounter channel in each of our key
	geographic markets and will pursue selected, profitable opportunities to increase our presence in the discounter channel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Approximately 6.5% of our
	sales for the nine month period ended December 31, 2015 were through the foodservice channel.&nbsp;The majority of these sales were in Sweden and consist primarily sales of institutional and public sector customers such as schools and hospitals as
	well as privately run work canteens and quick service restaurants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are also increasing our investment in online sales (sales made through
	retailers&#146; online platforms) including appointing a head of digital sales. We believe that the online sales channel provides an opportunity to help grow our share of food purchases, since frozen consistently ranks highly in terms of indices
	monitoring groceries bought online. In the United Kingdom, our online sales channel has been delivering double digit growth since 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Products
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We now place a strong emphasis on renovation of our existing core icons that seek to overcome penetration barriers and continue to build
	loyalty.&nbsp;We manage renovation and innovation centrally on European common product platforms and have more local involvement where products are differentiated and country specific.&nbsp;Our research and development continues to be centralized,
	allowing us to leverage our research and development investment across our markets and focus on our largest core icons.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Sales, Marketing and Pricing
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We maintain sales teams in each of our key markets and all other markets in which our products are sold with the exception of the Central and Eastern
	Europe markets where we operate via a distribution model. Our sales force is resourced to provide good store coverage. We are the &#147;category captain&#148; for several leading supermarkets in each of our main product categories and have developed
	innovative presentations of our frozen food products and in-store marketing concepts with supermarkets in a number of our markets in order to increase traffic and sales. Most recently, we are developing our &#147;Perfect Store&#148; concept which
	focuses on improving a consumer&#146;s in-store environment through presentation, layout and signage.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our brand equity strategy aims to further
	increase brand awareness.&nbsp;Our approach is to advertise local hero platforms and leverage our iconic local brand assets. Furthermore our focus on our core products means we will invest across only our priority platforms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Manufacturing
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We own and operate ten manufacturing
	facilities which are located in Lowestoft (United Kingdom), Bremerhaven (Germany), Reken (Germany), Cisterna (Italy), Bjuv/Helsingborg and Loftahammar (Sweden), Tonsberg and Larvik (Norway), Boulogne-sur-Mer (France) and
	Valladolid&nbsp;(Spain).&nbsp;These facilities produce approximately 500 kilotonnes of frozen product per year, representing approximately 80% of the total volumes of our sales.&nbsp;The manufacturing facilities are located near the major markets we
	serve, providing for a balance between manufacturing and logistics costs and customer service.&nbsp;Our manufacturing facilities are focused on in house manufacturing of our main product categories and emphasize quality and efficiency through
	scale.&nbsp;We have invested in new automated lines, such as fish fingers, poultry and spinach lines and because our plants are well invested and maintained, our capital expenditure requirements have been low.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	30
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Although capacity differs per product line and facility, we estimate that we have sufficient spare capacity
	available to accommodate future growth in our main product categories and as necessary to accommodate the seasonal nature of some of our products, particularly vegetables. As part of our &#147;right sizing the business&#148; initiative we closed our
	plant in Hull (United Kingdom) in 2007 to reduce overcapacity, outsourced our United Kingdom pea processing, and transferred manufacturing of certain icon products, such as fish fingers, to our Bremerhaven and Lowestoft facilities. Other activities,
	such as the production of ready meals in the United Kingdom and Austria and manufacturing of packaging materials, are outsourced to local third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On March 31, 2016, we announced the decision to request negotiations with the relevant trade unions about a potential closure of our Bjuv factory and
	pea processing operations by the end of 2016.&nbsp;The factory produces a range of vegetable and meal products for the retail and food service markets in Sweden, Denmark and Finland and production is expected to move to our Reken and Bremerhaven
	factories in Germany.&nbsp;The consolidation of operations is expected to create a more efficient supply chain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Procurement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our procurement functions are structured around primes (materials used in manufacturing which form a part of the end product, such as fish, vegetables,
	meat, other ingredients and packaging), non-production items (items purchased and services used to design, market and distribute the product, such as logistics, operations, including maintenance, sales and marketing) and co-pack (finished products
	bought from third parties, such as most vegetables other than peas and spinach).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have an efficient and centralized supply chain which is closely
	aligned with our geographic footprint, allowing us to optimize our supply arrangements and reduce distribution costs.&nbsp;We operate a centralized procurement function, with all procurement of primes and the majority of non-production items and
	co-pack procurement activities centralized to maximize scale efficiencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We operate a global sourcing platform.&nbsp;Fish is sourced mainly from
	the United States, Russia and China, vegetables are sourced predominantly from Europe and poultry is sourced largely from South America (but also from Thailand and Eastern Europe).&nbsp;We have contracts in place with pea and spinach growers and
	third party pea processors in regions close to the location of pea growers.&nbsp;In addition, we utilize various co-pack suppliers for vegetables other than peas and spinach.&nbsp;The contract terms we enter into with various suppliers differ
	extensively with respect to length and provisions.&nbsp;Some of our contracts can be terminated by the supplier giving notice within a certain period and some contracts restrict us from using other suppliers.&nbsp;In addition, a number of our supply
	contacts, including for fish and vegetables, may be terminated by the supplier upon a change in our ownership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We aim to maintain an appropriately
	diverse supplier base to safeguard the security of our supply of raw materials as well as enhance the quality and sustainability of such materials, while also delivering competitive pricing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We segregate vendors into &#147;strategic&#148; and &#147;tactical&#148; categories based on criteria such as bargaining power or opportunistic
	procurement. On that basis, we have identified a number of strategic suppliers with whom we maintain close relationships, particularly in relation to main product categories for which security of supply is critical. Raw materials are mostly directly
	shipped to our manufacturing facilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	31
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We limit our exposure to price increases of raw materials by contractually securing prices for periods
	ranging from one month to a full year.&nbsp;Prices of raw materials that are harvested annually are generally fixed for a full year.&nbsp;Prices for certain other products, such as fish, dairy products and potatoes, are fixed for several months in
	line with industry practice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Logistics
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our
	distribution network is made up of our manufacturing facilities, warehouses, local distribution centers and third party providers of services (such as transport).&nbsp;We outsource the majority of our distribution processes to third parties seeking
	to collaborate with shared sites and integrated transport networks.&nbsp;Our distribution network is well consolidated and aligned with our manufacturing footprint in the United Kingdom, Germany, Italy, Sweden, France, Norway and Spain, with the
	majority of the sales volumes in each of these key markets being produced locally.&nbsp;From our manufacturing plants, our products are sent to regional distribution centers to be further distributed to local markets.&nbsp;Our primary distribution
	centers are used to consolidate both local production and imported products to be sold locally.&nbsp;These sites include Wisbech in the United Kingdom, Reken in Germany, Vitulazio, Latina and Parma in Italy, Bjuv in Sweden, Lognes in France,
	Tonsberg and Moss in Norway and Marcilla in Spain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Seasonality
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our sales and working capital levels have historically been affected to a limited extent by seasonality.&nbsp;In general, sales volumes for frozen food
	are slightly higher in cold or winter months, partly because there are fewer fresh alternatives available for vegetables and because our retailers typically allocate more freezer space to the ice cream segment in summer or hotter months.&nbsp;In
	addition, variable production costs, including costs for seasonal staff, and working capital requirements associated with the keeping of inventories, vary depending on the harvesting and buying periods of seasonal raw materials, in particular
	vegetable crops.&nbsp;For example, stock levels typically peak in August to September just after the pea harvest, and as a result, we require more working capital during those months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Corporate Social Responsibility
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We operate a Corporate
	Social Responsibility program which is an important part of our brand positioning.&nbsp;It captures our commitment and vision of the role that we must play in bringing food to our consumers while tackling fundamental challenges in our environment
	and society.&nbsp;There are three primary focus areas:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Reduction of food waste.&nbsp;Frozen food can offer a more sustainable food choice because it can cut food spoilage and food waste due to the inherent portion control that is derived from an extended shelf-life.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Healthier meal choices.&nbsp;Our product innovations will help consumers make healthier meal choices.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Responsible sourcing.&nbsp;Our food products will be responsibly sourced and prepared.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Fisheries
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have continued a long-term leadership position to pioneer the certification of global sustainable fisheries. Our Sustainable Fisheries Development
	Policy requires us to use the world&#146;s most robust independent sustainable fisheries verification process, the Marine Stewardship Council standard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	It is our policy to only source farmed seafood from responsibly managed farms which operate to independent third party standards such as the Global
	Aquaculture Alliance (GAA), GlobalGAP and Aquaculture Stewardship Council standards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	32
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Agriculture&nbsp;&amp; Vegetables
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Together with over 1,000 growers, we currently manage approximately 24,000 hectares of land and our standards match or go beyond those required by most
	agricultural assurance schemes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our Agricultural Code of Practice requires us to produce crops with high yield and nutritional quality, while
	keeping resource demands as low as possible, thus minimizing adverse effects on soil fertility, water, air quality and biodiversity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Poultry
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All of our poultry is responsibly sourced from suppliers that have a vertically-integrated supply chain, enabling us to operate a Poultry Code of
	Practice under closely monitored conditions which covers feed, animal medicines usage, welfare, social standards, waste, and water and energy management.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Information Technology
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our IT systems are of key importance
	to our business and in particular to our general operations and logistics functions and associated management reporting across countries and our plants.&nbsp;A single SAP tool is the primary business software to support all of our operations and
	management reporting across countries and our supply chain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	This environment is well invested and is designed as a consolidation platform for
	future acquisitions.&nbsp;A program is underway to transition the recently acquired Findus business onto the IT platform.&nbsp;The program is planned to complete in 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The ability to integrate potential new acquisitions quickly with little or no adverse business impact, while maintaining the low cost of ownership, is a
	fundamental requirement of our IT strategy.&nbsp;Additionally, we utilize an outsourced infrastructure service provider, maintaining best in class IT cost alongside improved capability to scale in line with business developments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Intellectual Property
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Maintaining adequate brand protection
	is of significant importance to our business as we rely on our brands to implement our master brand strategy.&nbsp;We have a substantial trademark portfolio with nearly 2,100 trademarks across all of our markets.&nbsp;Our intellectual property is
	managed centrally, and we work closely with a third party agency in respect of filings, renewals, recordings and the prosecution and enforcement of intellectual property matters internationally.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We own a European Union Trade Mark as well as national trademarks for our Birds Eye brand in the United Kingdom, Ireland, other parts of Europe outside
	the European Union, parts of the Middle East, Asia and Africa.&nbsp;For historic reasons, the Birds Eye trademark is owned by third parties in North America and Australia.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We own a Community European Union Trade Mark for our Iglo brand in the European Union and national trademarks in other parts of Europe outside the
	European Union, Australasia, Israel, Saudi Arabia, parts of Asia, the United States, South America and Africa.&nbsp;We have trademark applications pending for the Iglo brand in, among others, Canada, India and Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We own the Findus trademark globally, other than in Switzerland, as well as the brands
<I>
	Lutosa
</I>
	(until 2020) and
<I>
	La Cocinera
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Material Contracts
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each material contract to which we or
	Iglo have been a party for the preceding two years, other than those entered into in the ordinary course of business, is listed as an exhibit to the registration statement to which this annual report is a part and is summarized elsewhere herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	33
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Pensions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We
	operate a number of different pension schemes across our various countries of operation, the majority of which are defined contribution schemes. We operate defined benefit pension plans in Germany, Sweden, Italy and Austria which are all closed to
	new entrants, as well as various defined contribution plans in other countries, the largest of which is in the United Kingdom to which we contributed
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.3&nbsp;million in the nine months ended December 31, 2015. In Germany, France, Italy and Norway, long term service awards are in operation and various
	other countries provide other employee benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Regulatory Matters
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our activities are subject to laws and regulations regarding food safety, the environment and occupational health and safety.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Food Safety Regulation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As a manufacturer of foods
	intended for human consumption, we are subject to extensive legislation and regulation both from the European Union and the EU Member States in which we operate.&nbsp;These regulations govern the composition, manufacture, storage, handling,
	packaging, labeling, marketing and safety of our products.&nbsp;These regulations generally impose on food business operators an obligation to ensure that the operations under their control satisfy the relevant food law requirements and impose a
	mandatory traceability requirement along the food chain.&nbsp;The tracing information must be kept for a period of five years and upon request, must be made available to the relevant authorities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition, we are subject to specific food hygiene legislation that establishes rules and procedures governing the hygiene of food products.&nbsp;This
	legislation sets forth specific rules governing the proper hygiene for food products of animal origin and sets forth microbiological criteria for food products.&nbsp;In addition there are a number of other specific EU requirements relating to
	specific matters such as contaminants, packaging materials and additives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are also subject to a broad range of European Directives and
	Regulations regarding the manufacture and sale of frozen foods for human consumption. These directives and regulations define technical standards of production, transport and storage of frozen foods intended for human consumption and require us to
	assure internal quality control at each stage of the &#147;cold chain&#148; and to implement any standards, as established by public authorities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Listed below are the various internal due diligence procedures we have established to ensure continuous compliance with all relevant regulatory and food
	safety standards:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	implementing food hygiene principles across all production sites in accordance with food hygiene regulations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	annual external auditing of our production sites conducted by independent compliance companies applying the British Retail Consortium Global Standard for Food Safety Issue 5 (Issue 6 from January 2012) or its European
	equivalent, the International Food Standard, and ensuring that our suppliers are also certified to these standards;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	ensuring that our Group&#146;s Quality Management Systems comply with ISO 9001 and are externally audited;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	conducting internal audits (including unannounced audits) covering all production sites as part of our internal audit program;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	maintaining a risk based microbiological and contaminant screening program, including screening for allergens, that covers raw materials and finished products; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	holding monthly regulatory updates which are open to our manufacturing plant technical managers and research and development team and quarterly policy board meetings to update and review outstanding issues.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	34
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Food Labeling Regulation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Pre-packaged food products must comply with provisions on labeling, which are harmonized throughout the European Union.&nbsp;Pre-packaged food products
	must also comply with provisions on nutrition labeling, which are also harmonized throughout the European Union.&nbsp;Nutrition labeling was optional but became mandatory if a nutrition or health claim appeared on the label or vitamins and/or
	minerals were added to the product in significant amounts.&nbsp;Under the Food Information for Consumers Regulation nutrition labeling is mandatory unless exempted (there is a transition period until 2016 when this requirement is fully applicable)
	although all of our pre-packaged food is already compliant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition to general and nutrition requirements, pre-packaged food products must bear
	a lot mark declaration via a manufacturing or packaging lot reference, which is also a harmonized system throughout the European Union.&nbsp;The lot reference allows consumers and businesses to trace the product in the event of a product withdrawal
	or recall.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There are also specific labeling requirements for certain ingredients we use in our products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Environmental Law
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The European Union has issued numerous
	directives relating to environmental protection, including those aimed at improving the quality of water, addressing air and noise pollution, assuring the safety of chemicals and setting standards for waste disposal and clean-up of
	contamination.&nbsp;European Directives are given effect by specific regulations in Member States and applicable regulations have been implemented in each of the countries in which we conduct our manufacturing activities.&nbsp;Accordingly, our
	facilities must obtain permits for certain operations and must comply with requirements relating to, among others, water supply and use, water discharges and air emissions, solid and hazardous waste storage, management and disposal of waste,
	clean-up of contamination and noise pollution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are also subject to legislation designed to reduce energy usage and carbon dioxide emissions and
	also restrictions on the use of ozone depleting substances such as hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs).&nbsp;HCFCs are used in refrigeration systems and their use will be phased out as part of our normal maintenance, repair and replacement activities
	and we do not expect a need for significant incremental capital expenditures for this purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Compliance with environmental laws and regulations
	is managed at the facility level.&nbsp;Our manufacturing facilities all have a detailed environmental management system which are externally audited on an annual basis for compliance with ISO 14001.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition, under some environmental laws and regulations, we could be responsible for contamination we may have caused and investigating or
	remediating contamination at properties we own or occupy, even if the contamination was caused by a prior owner or other third party or was not due to our fault, and even if the activity which resulted in the contamination was legal at the time it
	occurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Occupational Health and Safety
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have a
	legal responsibility to protect the health and safety of our employees, customers and members of the public, all of whom may be affected by our activities.&nbsp;In general, we are required to provide a safe workplace; control risks to health (and
	where applicable, eliminate such risks); ensure that our plants and machinery are safe and that work safety systems and guidelines are both established and adhered to; ensure that dangerous articles and substances are transported, stored and used
	safely; provide adequate welfare facilities; provide workers the information, instruction, training and supervision necessary to preserve their health and safety; and consult with workers on health and safety matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	35
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The European Framework Directive on Safety and Health at Work (89/391 EEC) guarantees minimum safety and
	health requirements throughout Europe.&nbsp;Member States are permitted to maintain or establish more stringent measures and a wide variety of European Union directives have become national law in some jurisdictions.&nbsp;As such, the legislative
	requirements for workplace safety and health vary across our business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have established a Health and Safety Management System modeled on the
	international Occupational Health&nbsp;&amp; Safety management system specification OHSAS 18001.&nbsp;Our manufacturing facilities in the United Kingdom, Italy and Germany have achieved full accreditation to OHSAS 18001.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Insurance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We maintain comprehensive insurance coverage,
	where appropriate, with respect to liability of our directors and officers, property damage, business interruption, cold storage facilities, public liability, products liability, product recall, damage to vehicles, personal accident and
	travel.&nbsp;We undertake periodic risk reviews to assess whether our insurance is in line with our business risks and whether the developments in insurance policies are reflective of the changes in our business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	36
</P>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Valladolid
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Vegetables, Free Flow Meals, Ready Meals, Pastry Products, Pizza
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	12,000 volume per year
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

<A NAME="D171646D20F_HTM_TX171646_11">

	Item 4A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unresolved Staff Comments
</B>

</EFX_COMPANY_INFORMATION>
<EFX_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW>
<A NAME="FIS_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D171646D20F_HTM_TX171646_12">
</A>
	Item
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	The following is a
	discussion of the financial condition and results of operations for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 and the twelve months ended March 31, 2015 of the Company and the five months ended May 31, 2015 and the years ended December 31, 2014 and
	2013 of our Predecessor, Iglo.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	We were formed on April 1, 2014 and had no operations until we acquired Iglo on June 1, 2015.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Some of the information contained in this discussion and analysis or set forth elsewhere in this annual report, including information with respect to
	our plans and strategy for our business and related financing, includes forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties.&nbsp;As a result of many factors, including those factors set forth in Item 3 Key Information-D.&nbsp;Risk
	Factors of this annual report, our actual results could differ materially from the results described in or implied by the forward-looking statements contained in the following discussion and analysis.&nbsp;This discussion should be read in
	conjunction with our audited historical consolidated financial statements and other financial information included elsewhere in this annual report.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	The following financial information has been derived from our audited consolidated financial statements, other than the unaudited consolidated
	financial data of Iglo for the six months ended June 30, 2014 which has been extracted from unaudited interim financial statements not included in this annual report.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	38
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	The historical financial information has been prepared in accordance with IFRS.&nbsp;In May 2015, the
	Company changed its fiscal year end from March&nbsp;31 to December 31.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We were incorporated with limited liability under the laws of the British Virgin Islands under the BVI Companies Act on April&nbsp;1, 2014 under the
	name Nomad Holdings Limited. We were formed to undertake an acquisition of a target company or business. On April&nbsp;15, 2014 we completed our initial public offering raising gross proceeds of approximately $500 million through the sale of
	ordinary shares in the United Kingdom (the &#147;2014 Offering&#148;), and were listed on the LSE under the symbol &#147;NHL&#148;. After the Iglo Acquisition on June 1, 2015, we changed our name to Nomad Foods Limited. Subsequently on January 12,
	2016, we transferred our listing from the LSE to NYSE under the symbol &#147;NOMD.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad operates in the European frozen food market, selling
	its products primarily to large grocery retailers either directly or through distribution arrangements primarily in the United Kingdom, Italy, Germany, Sweden, France and Norway.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our top six markets collectively represented approximately 77% of the total Western European frozen food markets (in terms of retail sales value) and
	generated 83% of our revenue in 2015. We also sell our products in Austria, Belgium, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Portugal, Switzerland, Denmark, The Netherlands and Spain. The brands under which we sell our products are &#147;Birds Eye&#148;
	in the United Kingdom and Ireland, &#147;Findus&#148; in Italy, San Marino, France, Spain and Scandinavia and &#147;Iglo&#148; in Germany and other continental markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We operate ten manufacturing plants, two in Germany, two in Sweden, two in Norway and one in each of the United Kingdom, Spain, Italy and France.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Financings and Acquisitions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In May 2015, we issued
	75,666,669 of our ordinary shares in a private placement at a price of $10.50 per ordinary share (the &#147;May 2015 Offering&#148;). In April 2015, we amended the Warrants to accelerate the expiration date to the closing of the Iglo Acquisition
	(subject to certain limited exceptions) and, in order to incentivize the Warrant holders to exercise their Warrants prior to the new expiration date, we reduced the exercise price of the Warrants from $11.50 to $10.50 per whole ordinary share for
	all Warrants exercised before the new expiration date. Between May and June 2015, we issued an aggregate of 16,673,307 ordinary shares pursuant to the exercise of the Warrants. There are no Warrants currently outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On June&nbsp;1, 2015, we consummated our initial acquisition by purchasing Iglo Foods Holdings Limited, a leading frozen food manufacturer and
	distributor in Europe. We paid an aggregate purchase price of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.6 billion, including assumed debt of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.2 billion and the issuance of 13,743,094 ordinary shares (the &#147;Iglo Seller Shares&#148;) to the seller, a private equity fund advised by Permira Advisers LLP. We financed the Iglo Acquisition
	through a combination of available cash from the 2014 Offering, the May 2015 Offering and the early exercise of Warrants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the July&nbsp;2015
	Offering, we issued 15,445,346 ordinary shares at a price of $20.75 per ordinary share.&nbsp;The number of ordinary shares issued in the July 2015 Offering represented, in aggregate, approximately 9.99% of our issued ordinary share capital
	immediately prior to the offering.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 2, 2015, we acquired the Findus Group for approximately &pound;500&nbsp;million (subject to
	customary post-closing adjustments), consisting of &pound;415 million in cash and 8,378,380 Findus Consideration Shares. Through the Findus Acquisition, we have acquired the continental European businesses of the Findus Parent in Sweden, Norway,
	Finland, Denmark, France, Spain and Belgium relating to the
<I>
	Findus
</I>
	,
<I>
	Lutosa
</I>
	, and
<I>
	La Cocinera
</I>
	brands. Findus is a leading frozen food manufacturer in continental Europe. The operations acquired include approximately 1,500
	employees and six manufacturing facilities in Norway, Sweden, France and Spain. Findus revenues for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 were &pound;471 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	39
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The &pound;415&nbsp;million cash portion of the Findus purchase price was funded through a combination of
	cash on hand and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	285 million of a new
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million senior term
	loan under our existing Senior Facilities Agreement. Additionally, the Findus Seller was issued the Findus Consideration Shares at closing. The Findus Seller will be restricted from transferring any of the Findus Consideration Shares within one year
	following closing and will be restricted from transferring 50% of the Findus Consideration Shares within two years of closing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We intend to seek to
	acquire further businesses to build an integrated group of best-in-class companies and brands within existing, as well as new, related food categories.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Accounting for the Iglo Acquisition
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Effective from the date
	of the Iglo Acquisition, we have reflected the Iglo Acquisition in our consolidated financial statements prepared in accordance with IFRS. The Iglo Acquisition is accounted for using the purchase method as required by IFRS 3 &#147;Business
	Combinations&#148;. The net assets of the Iglo Group have been adjusted to our estimate of fair value as of June&nbsp;1, 2015, the date when control of the Iglo Group passed to us. The excess of the costs of acquisition over the fair value of the
	assets and liabilities of the Iglo Group has been recorded as goodwill. We are currently assessing the purchase price allocation and such fair values are provisional.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Accounting for the Findus Acquisition
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have reflected the
	Findus Acquisition in our consolidated financial statements prepared in accordance with IFRS from the date of the acquisition, November 2, 2015.&nbsp;In the nine months ended December 31, 2015 we present two months of operations in our consolidated
	results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We have accounted for the Findus Acquisition using the purchase method as required by IFRS 3 &#147;Business Combinations&#148;. The net
	assets of the Findus Acquisition has been adjusted to fair value as of November 2, 2015, the date when control passed to us. The excess of the costs of acquisition over the fair value of the assets and liabilities of the Findus Acquisition is
	recorded as goodwill. The fair values have been determined on a provisional basis and as such the purchase price allocation and fair values are provisional.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	40
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	Gross Margin
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;Gross margin represents gross profit as a percentage of revenue for the relevant period.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	Adjusted EBITDA
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA is net (loss)/profit for the period before taxation, net financing costs, depreciation, amortization, exceptional items, charges relating to the Founder Preferred
	Shares Annual Dividend Amount, charges relating to Warrant redemption and other similar items.&nbsp;We believe that Adjusted EBITDA is a useful indicator of our ability to incur and service its indebtedness and in assessing the underlying
	performance of its business and can assist securities analysts, investors and other parties to perform their own evaluation.&nbsp;Accordingly, the information has been disclosed in this annual report to permit a more complete and comprehensive
	analysis of our operating performance. You should exercise caution in comparing our Adjusted EBITDA with similarly titled measures of other companies. Adjusted EBITDA is not a measure of liquidity or performance calculated in accordance with IFRS
	and should be viewed as a supplement to, not a substitute for, our results of operations presented in accordance with IFRS.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	Adjusted EBITDA Margin
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA margin represents Adjusted EBITDA as a percentage of revenue for the relevant period. Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin are non-IFRS measures and you
	should not consider them an alternative or substitute to operating profit or operating margin as a measure of operating performance.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	41
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Description of Key Line Items and Certain Key Performance Indicators
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Set forth below is a brief description of key items from our consolidated statements of income.&nbsp;For additional information, see Note 1 to our
	audited consolidated financial statements which appear elsewhere in this annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Revenue
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue is comprised of
	sales of goods after deduction of discounts and sales taxes. It does not include sales between Nomad subsidiaries. Discounts given by us include rebates, price reductions and incentives given to customers, promotional couponing and trade
	communication costs. At each end date of a reporting period, any discount incurred, but not yet invoiced, is estimated and accrued. Revenue is recognized when the risks and rewards of the underlying products have been transferred to the customer.
	This is usually upon either the dispatch of a shipment or the delivery of goods to the customer but is dependent upon contractual terms that have been agreed with a customer. Sales discounts incurred but not yet invoiced are established based on
	management&#146;s best estimate at the end of the reporting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Other Operating Expenses
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Other operating expenses are
	comprised of advertising and promotions, exchange movements and indirect costs.&nbsp;Indirect costs include staff costs, selling and marketing expenses, administration expenses, research and development expenses, amortization of software,
	amortization of brands and other expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Charges related to Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The charges
	relate to the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount by which the holders of Founder Preferred Shares are entitled to receive dividends, subject to certain performance conditions.&nbsp;Before June&nbsp;1, 2015, the Founder Preferred Shares
	Annual Dividend Amount was fair valued periodically.&nbsp;We expect to settle any Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount with equity and, therefore, the liability has been classified as an equity reserve as of June 1, 2015 and no further
	revaluations are expected.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Charges relating to Warrant redemption
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The charges relate to the redemption rights of any
	outstanding Warrants which were fair valued at each balance sheet date with any changes in fair value charged to the income statement.&nbsp;There are no Warrants currently outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Exceptional items
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The separate reporting of exceptional items which are presented as exceptional within the relevant income
	statement category helps provide an indication of our underlying business performance.&nbsp;Exceptional items have been identified and adjusted by virtue of their size, nature or incidence.&nbsp;In determining whether an event or transaction is
	exceptional, management considers quantitative as well as qualitative factors such as the frequency or predictability of occurrence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	42
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Finance Income
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Finance income is comprised of interest income, other financing
	related income and net foreign exchange gains on translations of financial assets and liabilities held in currencies other than the Company&#146;s functional currency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Finance Costs
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Finance costs are comprised of interest expenses, net interest on net defined pension plan obligations,
	amortization of borrowing costs, net foreign exchange costs on translations of financial assets and liabilities held in currencies other than the Company&#146;s functional currency and financing costs incurred as a result of amendments of debt
	terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Taxation
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Taxation is comprised of current tax expenses and deferred tax movements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We also utilize certain additional key performance indicators, as described below.&nbsp;We believe these measures provide an important alternative
	measure with which to assess our underlying trading performance on a constant basis.&nbsp;Our calculation of Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin may be different from the calculations used by other companies and therefore comparability may be
	limited.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin are non-IFRS measures and you should not consider them an alternative or substitute to operating profit or operating margin as a measure of operating performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Gross Margin
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross margin is gross profit as a percentage of revenue.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Adjusted EBITDA
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA is net (loss)/profit for the period before taxation, net financing costs, depreciation,
	amortization, exceptional items, charges relating to the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount, charges relating to Warrant redemption and other similar items.&nbsp;We believe that Adjusted EBITDA is a useful indicator of our ability to
	incur and service our indebtedness and in assessing the underlying performance of our business and can assist securities analysts, investors and other parties to perform their own evaluation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Accordingly, the information has been disclosed in this annual report to permit a more complete and comprehensive analysis of our operating
	performance.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are used by different companies for different purposes and are often calculated in ways that reflect the individual needs and circumstances of these companies.&nbsp;You should exercise caution
	in comparing our Adjusted EBITDA with similarly titled measures of other companies.&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA is not a measure of liquidity or performance calculated in accordance with IFRS and should be viewed as a supplement to, not a substitute for,
	our results of operations presented in accordance with IFRS.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Adjusted EBITDA Margin
</I>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA margin is Adjusted
	EBITDA as a percentage of revenue.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Currency
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our
	consolidated financial statements have been presented in Euro, which is our functional currency.&nbsp;Unless specifically stated otherwise herein, transactions in foreign currencies have been translated at the foreign exchange rate at the date of
	the relevant transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Changes in foreign currency rates have a translation impact on our reported operating results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A significant portion of our operations have functional currencies other than Euro (principally Pound Sterling).&nbsp;In preparing its financial
	statements, translations in currencies other than our functional currency are recognized at the rates of exchange prevailing at the dates of transaction.&nbsp;Accordingly, our results for each of the periods presented below have been impacted by
	fluctuations in foreign exchange rates.&nbsp;Where material, our results, excluding the currency impacts, have been provided.&nbsp;Results presented excluding currency impacts are not presented in accordance with IFRS.&nbsp;Non-IFRS financial
	measures are intended to supplement the applicable IFRS disclosures and should not be viewed as a replacement of IFRS results.&nbsp;We believe excluding the impact of changes in exchange rates allows for better comparability of results between
	periods and provides an additional and meaningful assessment of the performance of the business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	43
</P>

</B>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revenue
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	894.2&nbsp;
</TD>
