<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revenue for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	894.2 million representing seven months of operations of the Iglo Group from June 2015 through December 2015 and two months of operations of the Findus Acquisition. Prior to the Iglo Acquisition, Nomad
	had no operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Gross profit for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	231.2 million and gross margin was 25.9%. The results for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 include a one-time
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	37.0 million fair value charge relating to a step-up in inventory values and a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.9 million charge in relation to cash flow hedge accounting as part of the Iglo and Findus Acquisitions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Other operating expenses increased to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	138.6 million for
	the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 in comparison to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.7 million in the year ended March 31, 2015. The increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	137.9 million primarily relates to seven months of Iglo and two months of Findus operating expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Charges related to the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount increased to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	349.0 million for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 in comparison to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	165.8 million in the year ended
	March&nbsp;31, 2015. The charge relates to the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount which was fair valued as of June 1, 2015. We expect to settle any Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount with equity and therefore the liability
	has been reclassified as an equity reserve as of June&nbsp;1, 2015 and no further revaluations are expected.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Exceptional items of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	58.1 million in the nine months ended December 31, 2015 relate to the transaction-related costs incurred by Nomad in connection with the Iglo Acquisition and the
	Findus Acquisition of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	28.2 million, other costs related to transactions of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.4 million, investigation of strategic opportunities and other items of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.6 million, other restructuring costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.9 million, the
	Findus Group integration costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.5 million, costs related to management incentive plans of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.5 million and net income related to the Cisterna fire of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.5 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net finance costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	35.5 million in the nine months ended
	December 31, 2015 relate to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	38.8 million of interest payable on debt assumed as part of the Iglo Acquisition,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.9 million of other interest and finance costs and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.5 million resulting from the translation of foreign
	currency-denominated financial assets and liabilities into Euros offset by finance income of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.7 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	44
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Loss for the period
</B>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	&nbsp;

</B>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our revenue decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	120.9 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	640.3 million for the five months ended
	May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	761.2 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month of operations in 2014, the decrease in revenue
	was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.2 million. Our exit from Romania, Slovakia and Turkey in 2015 and the one additional day in 2014 accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.8 million of the decline. We believe, based on external market data, that a significant portion of the remaining decrease was driven by continued growth in the
	discounter channel and an increase in private label offerings by traditional retailers. Furthermore, reduced promotional slots in Italy due to longer-than-expected annual negotiations with key customers impacted revenue by approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.1 million. Those impacts were partially offset by a foreign exchange translational benefit from our U.K. business as a result of the stronger Sterling-to-Euro
	exchange rate and increased revenue in the Netherlands and Portugal. Excluding the foreign exchange translational benefit and the additional month in 2014, revenue would have decreased 5.9% or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	39.3 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Gross profit decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	42.1 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	222.4 million for the five months ended May 31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	264.5 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. The additional month in 2014 accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	38.3 million of the decline. Excluding the additional month in 2014, the decrease was driven by lower revenue. Gross margin was 34.7% for the five months ended May 31, 2015 and the six months ended June
	30, 2014 as higher promotional investments were offset by the introduction of new margin accretive products and supply chain improvements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Other
	operating expenses increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	48.1 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	193.8 million
	for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	145.7 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month in 2014, other
	operating expenses increased
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	72.3 million primarily due to an increase in exceptional items of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	76.8 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Costs for advertising and promotions decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	15.5 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	49.3 million for the five months ended May&nbsp;31,
	2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	64.8 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. The additional month in 2014 accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.2 million of the decline. Excluding the additional month in 2014, the decrease was primarily due to the non-recurrence of costs associated with the development of the new marketing strategy in 2014 and
	advertising cost savings and efficiencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	45
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Indirect expenses decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.3 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	60.2 million for the five months ended
	May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	69.5 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month in 2014, indirect expenses increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.8 million, primarily due to a foreign exchange translational impact from Sterling-based costs in our U.K. business as a result of the stronger Sterling-to-Euro
	exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Exceptional items increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	72.9
	million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	84.3 million for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.4 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month in 2014, exceptional items increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	76.8 million primarily due to a one-time
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	55.0 million carrying
	value adjustment of our intangible assets in Italy and a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	22.9 million charge related to the acceleration of awards under the Iglo Long-Term Incentive Plans
	upon the closing of the Iglo Acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net finance costs decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	18.3 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	115.7 million for the five months ended
	May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	134.0 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month in 2014, net financing costs increased
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.2 million primarily due to foreign exchange translational losses on our financial assets and liabilities principally as a result of the stronger
	Sterling-to-Euro exchange rate, partially offset by lower net interest costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.0 million due to the refinancing in July 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Tax expenses increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	15.6 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	40.9 million for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	25.3
	million for the six months ended June 30, 2014. Excluding the additional month in 2014, tax expense increased
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	19.8 million. The increase in the tax charge
	was largely attributable to a one-time adjustment to current tax of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.3 million and to a deferred tax debit of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.1 million following a fair value review conducted as a result of the Iglo Acquisition. Based on an effective tax rate methodology, the current tax charge for the five months ended May 31, 2015 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	20.5 million.
</P>

</B>

	m

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

	Loss for the period
</B>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our revenue decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.9 million, or 0.3%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,500.9 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,505.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. We believe, based on external market data, that the decrease in revenue
	was primarily due to growth in the discounter channel across UK, Italy and Germany as well as lower promotional levels particularly in Germany during annual customer negotiations which impacted revenue by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9 million. Furthermore there were on-going negotiations during the year with a medium sized retailer in the United Kingdom resulting in limited distributions and promotions until the last quarter of 2014
	which led to a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	17 million decrease in revenue. The decrease in revenue was primarily offset by a foreign exchange translational benefit in our U.K.
	business and revenue growth in our Italy business following implementation of a new product strategy and increased advertising. Excluding the currency impact, revenue decreased by 2.0% or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	31.8 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Gross profit increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	26.0 million, or 5.2%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	530.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	504.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. Gross margin increased to 35.3% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from 33.5% for the year ended
	December 31, 2013 primarily as a result of the introduction of new margin accretive products, product mix improvements and cost controls which offset the revenue decline. Gross profit benefitted from a foreign currency translational benefit from our
	U.K. business as a result of the stronger Sterling-to-Euro exchange rates which resulted in a 3.3%, or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	17.0 million, increase in gross profit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	46
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Other operating expenses decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.5 million, or 2.7%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	307.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	315.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The decrease was primarily due to significantly lower exceptional items partially offset by increases in
	advertising and promotion and indirect costs. Other operating expenses as a percentage of revenue decreased to 20.5% in 2014 from 21.0% in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our costs for advertising and promotions increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	12.1
	million, or 12.0%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	113.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	101.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The increase was primarily due to development of a new advertising campaign and packaging re-launch
	coupled with increased media spend in Italy, Germany and the United Kingdom.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Indirect costs increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.4 million, or 8.0%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	141.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	130.7 million for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2013. The increase was primarily due to investment in marketing capability along with R&amp;D capacity and
	higher bonus costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Exceptional items decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	30.9 million, or 36.9%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	52.9 million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	83.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The decrease was primarily the result of the higher level of exceptional
	items in 2013 from developing and implementing the &#147;Better Meals Together&#148; strategy as well as a registration tax payment in Italy relating to the acquisition of Findus Italy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net financing costs increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	62.6 million, or 27.5%,
	to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	290.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	227.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The increase in net financing costs was primarily due to a one-time charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	37.9 million in connection with re-financing of Iglo&#146;s debt in July 2014, which related primarily to the write-off of deferred borrowing costs from a
	previous re-financing. The remaining increase was primarily driven by foreign exchange translational losses on our financial assets and liabilities principally as a result of the stronger Sterling-to-Euro exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Tax expenses increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	39.8 million to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	41.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.0
	million for the year ended December 31, 2013. This charge is split between a current tax expense of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#128;
</FONT>
	27.5 million and a net deferred tax charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.3 million, compared to a current tax expense of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	16.6 million and a net deferred tax credit of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.6 million for the prior year. The increase in current tax expense was primarily due to an increase in taxable profits. The variance in the deferred tax charge
	was primarily attributable to a change in deferred tax rates from 23% to 20% as well as a credit in 2013, which resulted from an adjustment to the calculation of deferred tax on intangibles, while a charge was recognized in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Other Key Performance Indicators
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Adjusted
	EBITDA increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.1 million, or 2.0%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	306.2 million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	300.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. Adjusted EBITDA margin increased to 20.4% for the year
	ended December 31, 2014, from 19.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 as a result of higher gross margins. The increase in Adjusted EBITDA was primarily due to a foreign currency translational benefit from our U.K. business as a result of a
	stronger Sterling-to-Euro exchange rate. Excluding currency impacts, Adjusted EBITDA remained relatively flat.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	47
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Overview
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We believe that cash flow from
	operating activities, available cash and cash equivalents and our access to our revolving credit facility will be sufficient to fund our liquidity requirements for at least the next 12 months. At December 31, 2015, we had
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	256.6 million of total liquidity, comprising
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	186.1 million in cash,
	net of bank overdrafts, and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	70.5 million of available borrowings under our revolving credit facility. We also expect to continue to raise cash through
	equity and debt offerings when it is advisable to do so. Our principal liquidity requirements have been, and we expect will be, for working capital and general corporate purposes, including capital expenditures and debt service, as well as to
	identify and effect strategic acquisitions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Cash Flows
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our primary sources of liquidity for the periods reported were cash flow from operations and financing activities.&nbsp;Cash flows from financing
	activities have in the past included, among other things, borrowings under credit facilities, high yield notes and shareholder loan notes.&nbsp;Our liquidity requirements arise primarily from the need to meet debt service requirements, to fund
	capital expenditures, to meet working capital requirements and to fund pension and tax obligations.&nbsp;Cash flows generated from operating activities, together with cash flows generated from financing activities, have historically been sufficient
	to meet the our liquidity needs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table summarizes net cash flows with respect to our operating, investing and financing activities
	for the periods indicated:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Net Cash from Operating Activities
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash from operating activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	48.0 million for
	the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, up from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.2&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#128;
</FONT>
	47.8 million increase was primarily due to the acquisition of Iglo, with seven months of Iglo operations consolidated, and the Findus Acquisition, contributing two months of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in operating activities for the year ended March 31, 2015 was primarily related to ongoing costs and expenses prior to the Iglo
	Acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in operating activities for the five months ended May 31, 2015 related to ongoing operations. Net cash from operating
	activities increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	30.1 million, or 12.7%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	267.4
	million for the year ended December 31, 2014, from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	237.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The increase was primarily due to lower tax and
	exceptional items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	48
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Net Cash Used in Investing Activities
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in investing activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	959.8 million
	for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, increasing from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	295.6 million for the year ended March 31, 2015. The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	664.2 million increase was primarily due to the Iglo Acquisition of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	693.6 million, the Findus Acquisition of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	556.9 million and
	offset by redemption of portfolio investments of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	312.1 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in investing activities for the year ended March 31, 2015, relating to investment of our cash prior to the Iglo Acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in investing activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.3 million for
	the five months ended May 31, 2015 which primarily related to capital expenditures.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in investing activities decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.0 million, or 7.1%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	26.3 million for the year ended December
	31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	28.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The decrease was primarily due to phasing of capital expenditures over the two years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Net Cash Provided by Financing Activities
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash provided by financing activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	952.5
	million for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, up from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	353.5 million for the year ended March 31, 2015. The net cash provided by financing
	activities was primarily due to proceeds from the sale of shares in the May and July 2015 Offerings of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,171.8 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million drawn on the senior facilities to fund the Iglo Acquisition and the Findus Acquisition, offset by a repayment of loan principal of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	490.0 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	40.8 million of interest paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash provided by financing activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	353.5
	million for the year ended March 31, 2015, primarily resulting from the issuance of ordinary shares in the 2014 Offering.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in
	financing activities was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	29.4 million for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily related to interest payable on the senior debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net cash used in financing activities increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	237.5
	million, or 222.6%, to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	344.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2014 from
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	106.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The increase was primarily attributable to the repayment of senior debt by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	236.9 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	129.2 million of which was an excess cash payment in
	line with the former debt package covenants and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	107.7 million of which was a net repayment as part of the new finance agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Capital Expenditures
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our capital
	expenditures in 2015 consisted, and in 2016 we expect to consist of, primarily expenditures for factory capacity expansion and maintenance, cost savings projects, information systems, innovation, regulatory compliance and other items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our capital expenditure averaged 1.8% of revenue from 2013 to 2015.&nbsp;The following table sets forth our capital expenditures for the periods
	indicated, including as a percentage of revenue:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Debt
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Senior Facilities Agreement
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the Iglo Acquisition, Iglo&#146;s Senior Facilities Agreement (&#147;SFA&#148;) was
	amended and restated effective as of June 1, 2015. Commitments and participations of the lenders that opted not to exchange their existing commitment participations, or were otherwise in excess of agreed allocations for the existing, consenting
	lenders, which totaled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	490 million, were prepaid and cancelled in full at the closing of the Iglo Acquisition. In connection with the Findus Acquisition,
	the SFA was further amended and restated to add a new
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million senior term loan tranche and to make certain conforming amendments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The SFA currently consists of (i) a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	363.3 million term
	loan facility (Facility C1), (ii) a &pound;235 million term loan facility (Facility C2), (iii) a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million term loan facility (Facility C3) and (iv) an
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	80.0 million revolving credit facility of which up to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.0 million
	can be used for the issuance of letters of credit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of December 31, 2015, we had approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,008.4 million of indebtedness outstanding under our term loan facilities and no amounts outstanding under our revolving credit facility, other than
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.5 million in stand-by letters of credit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The term loans under the SFA mature on June 30, 2020 and
	bear interest at rates per annum equal to LIBOR or, in relation to any loan in Euro, EURIBOR, plus certain applicable margins.&nbsp;The applicable margins in relation to the term loans under the SFA are subject to adjustment (up or down as
	appropriate) in accordance with the margin adjustment mechanism based on the ratio of Consolidated Total Net Debt to Consolidated EBITDA (each as defined in the SFA) for the relevant period of 12 months and is 3.50% per annum in respect of the
	Facility C1 term loan and is 4.00% per annum in respect of the Facility C2 and Facility C3 term loans.&nbsp;Interest on the term loans is payable at the end of each interest period which, at the option of the borrower, may be one, two, three or six
	months or any other period agreed with the facility agent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The revolving credit facility matures on December 31, 2019 and bears interest at a rate
	per annum equal to LIBOR or, in relation to any loan in Euro, EURIBOR, plus the applicable margin.&nbsp;The applicable margin is subject to adjustment (up or down as appropriate) in accordance with the margin adjustment mechanism based on the ratio
	of Consolidated Total Net Debt to Consolidated EBITDA (each as defined in the SFA) for the relevant period of 12 months and range from 3.75% per annum to 4.25% per annum.&nbsp;Interest on the revolving credit facility is payable at the end of each
	interest period which, at the option of the borrower, may be one, two, three or six months or any other period agreed with the facility agent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	SFA contains certain customary negative operating covenants (certain of which are not applicable depending on the ratio of Consolidated Total Net Debt to Consolidated EBITDA) and other customary provisions relating to events of default, including
	non-payment of principal, interest or fees, misrepresentations, breach of covenants, creditor process, cross default to other indebtedness of the borrowers and its subsidiaries in excess of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	20.0 million, cessation of business, and material adverse change.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Floating Rate Senior Secured
	Notes due 2020
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nomad has outstanding
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	500,000,000 of Floating Rate Senior Secured Notes due 2020 (the &#147;Notes&#148;) issued pursuant to
	an indenture dated July 17, 2014 (the &#147;Indenture&#148;) entered into between certain subsidiaries of Nomad Foods Limited, the trustee for the noteholders and certain other parties. The Notes are currently admitted to the Official List of the
	Luxembourg Stock Exchange and for trading on the Euro MTF Market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Indenture contains customary covenants including limitations on indebtedness,
	restricted payments, liens, restrictions on distributions, sales of assets and subsidiary stock, affiliate transactions, activities of the Issuer and compliance requirements with respect to additional guarantees, reporting, additional intercreditor
	agreements, payment of notes, withholding taxes, change of control, compliance certificate, payments for consent and listing requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	50
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Interest on the Notes accrues at a rate per annum, reset quarterly, equal to three-month EURIBOR plus
	4.50%, as determined by the calculation agent and is payable quarterly in arrears.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Notes are redeemable at our option in whole or in part, from
	time to time, upon not less than 10 days nor more than 60 days&#146; prior notice, (x) prior to July 17, 2016 at a redemption price equal to 101% of principal amount being redeemed plus accrued and unpaid interest to the redemption date and (y) on
	or after July 17, 2016 at a redemption price equal to 100% of principal amount being redeemed plus accrued and unpaid interest to the redemption date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Pension Plans
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We maintain defined benefit
	pension plans in Germany, Sweden, Italy and Austria as well as various contributions plans in other countries. The defined benefit pension plans are partially funded in Germany and Austria and unfunded in Sweden and Italy. All defined benefit
	pension plans are closed to new entrants and there is no current requirement to fund the deficit in any of Germany, Sweden or Italy. We also maintain various defined contribution pension plans in other countries, the largest of which is in the
	United Kingdom with Company contributions of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.3 million in the nine months ended December 31, 2015 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.5 million in the year ended December 31, 2014. In most countries, long term service awards are in operation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For accounting purposes, as of December 31, 2015 (based on the assumptions used), the deficit for the defined benefit plans equaled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	159.4 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the nine months ended December 31, 2015
	pension costs related to defined benefit, defined contributions and long-term benefit plans equated to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.2 million. For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 and 2013 such costs equaled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.2 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.0
	million respectively. This includes all costs related to the pension schemes and other long-term benefits plans as well as associated interest costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For additional information, see Note 23 &#147;Employee benefits&#148; to our audited consolidated financial statements which appear elsewhere in this
	annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A description of our principal accounting policies, critical accounting estimates and key judgments is set out in Note 2 to our
	audited consolidated statements which appear elsewhere in this annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	C.&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development, patents and licenses, etc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We focus our efforts on renovation of core products and our investment in market research on our &#147;must win battles&#148; to ensure that the
	products we launch overcome penetration barriers. In addition, we have sought to implement a structured stage gate process through which we take new products from idea generation, through concept screening, concept/products laboratories and early
	volume sizing, to final validation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We operate one central &#147;Innovation&nbsp;&amp; Growth Board&#148; which is responsible for reviewing and
	approving innovations across the Company. Our research and development team is also centralized, allowing us to leverage our research and development investment across our markets, thus maximizing our ability to generate successful innovations
	efficiently.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We spent
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	12.1 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 and the year ended March 31, 2015 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	7.2 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	15.7 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	13.2 million in the five months ended May 31, 2015 and the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2013 respectively on company-sponsored research and development
	activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	51
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	D.&nbsp;&nbsp;Trend information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We are subject to the following key industry trends and challenges which have impacted, and may continue to impact, our business, operations and
	financial performance:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" COLOR="#000000">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Consumer Preferences
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Consumer preferences drive demand for our products. There are a number of trends in consumer preferences which are having an impact on us and the frozen food industry as a whole.
	These include preferences for convenient, natural, better value, healthy and sustainable products. Our results of operation depend in large part on the continued appeal of our products and, given the varied backgrounds and tastes of our customer
	base, our ability to offer a sufficient range of products to satisfy a broad spectrum of preferences. In order to address consumer needs and ensure the continued success of our products, we aim to introduce new products and re-launch and extend
	existing product lines on a timely basis. We believe the increased focus on healthy and natural products is an opportunity for us. We recently launched our &#147;Whole Grain&#148; platform, which is intended to offer some of our core iconic products
	with a healthier coating.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" COLOR="#000000">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Economic Conditions
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;During a weak macroeconomic environment, such as that experienced in recent years in certain of our markets, consumer buying patterns shift as consumers look for value
	alternatives.&nbsp;This has caused an increase in the percentage of products sold on promotion, a shift from traditional retail grocery to discounter channels and greater purchases of more economical, private label products.&nbsp;When our sales
	volumes decline, we are less able to pass along higher production costs.&nbsp;As a result, we are continuously focused on reducing costs through improved productivity and efficiency.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" COLOR="#000000">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Competition
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to the competition we face from traditional, well-established branded frozen food manufacturers, over the last few years we have seen increased competition from the discounter
	channel.&nbsp;Discounters are supermarket retailers which offer food and grocery products at discounted prices and which typically focus on non-branded rather than branded products.&nbsp;The discounter channel has been growing at a faster rate than
	the traditional retailer channels over the last several years.&nbsp;To address this growing trend, we intend to pursue selected, profitable opportunities to increase our presence with the discounter channel.&nbsp;With the growth of the discounter
	channel, in an effort to compete, our traditional retail customers have increased their offering of their own private label products.&nbsp;Because these customers control the shelf space allocations within their stores, they may allocate more shelf
	space to their private label products in accordance with their respective promotional strategies.&nbsp;To address decreases in shelf space allocated to our products, we may reduce our prices, either directly or through increased promotional
	activity, or invest greater amounts in advertising our products to ensure our products remain competitive.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	E.&nbsp;&nbsp;Off-balance sheet
	arrangements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	We did not have any material off-balance sheet arrangements during the reported periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	52
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>

<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D171646D20F_HTM_TX171646_13">
</A>
	Item 6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Directors, Senior Management and Employees
</B>
</P>
<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Executive Officers and Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	following table lists each of our executive officers and directors and their respective ages and positions as of March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:20PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="83%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Name
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Set forth below is a brief biography of each of our executive officers and directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	St&eacute;fan Descheemaeker
</I>
</B>
	was appointed as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and of Iglo on June&nbsp;1, 2015. He was
	previously at Delhaize Group SA, the international food retailer, where he was Chief Financial Officer between 2008 and 2011 before becoming Chief Executive Officer of its European division until October 2013. Since leaving Delhaize Group SA,
	Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker has taken on board positions with Telenet Group Holdings N.V. and Group Psychologies, served as an industry advisor to Bain Capital and been a professor at the Universit&eacute; Libre de Bruxelles. Between 1996 and 2008,
	Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker was at Interbrew (now Anheuser-Busch Inbev) where he was Head of Strategy&nbsp;&amp; External Growth responsible for managing M&amp;A and strategy, during the time of the merger of Interbrew and AmBev in 2004, and prior to
	that he held operational management roles as Zone President in the U.S., Central and Eastern Europe, and Western Europe. Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker started his career with Cobepa, at that time the Benelux investment company of BNP-Paribas.
	Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker currently serves as a Director on the Board of Anheuser-Busch InBev, a position he has held since 2008.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	53
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Paul Kenyon
</I>
</B>
	was appointed as Chief Financial Officer of the Company on June&nbsp;1, 2015,
	having previously served as Chief Financial Officer of Iglo since June 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Kenyon joined the Iglo Group from AstraZeneca PLC where his most recent role was CFO for AstraZeneca&#146;s Global Commercial business. Prior to that,
	Mr.&nbsp;Kenyon spent three years as Senior Vice President, Group Finance and for a period held the role of Chairman of AstraTech, AstraZeneca&#146;s medical technology subsidiary, concluding with its successful disposal. Mr.&nbsp;Kenyon&#146;s
	prior career includes a broad range of senior finance roles at Allied Domecq PLC as well as experience gained at Mars, Incorporated and Courtaulds PLC. Mr.&nbsp;Kenyon is a Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Tania Howarth
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;was appointed Chief Operating Officer of&nbsp;Iglo&nbsp;in January 2010.&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Howarth joined Iglo in April
	2007 and successfully led the separation from Unilever and the creation of a standalone integrated SAP platform.&nbsp;She has held senior positions at prestigious branded goods companies including Coca-Cola, where she served as the Chief Information
	Officer for Europe, the Middle East and Africa, PepsiCo where she served as Chief Information Officer for the Walkers Snackfood business, Sun Microsystems ICI and PricewaterhouseCoopers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Martin E. Franklin
</I>
</B>
	is the founder and Executive Chairman of Jarden Corporation, a broad based consumer products company
	(&#147;Jarden&#148;). Mr.&nbsp;Franklin was appointed to Jarden&#146;s board of directors in June 2001 and served as Jarden&#146;s chairman and chief executive officer from September 2001 until June 2011, at which time he began service as executive
	chairman. Prior to joining Jarden Corporation, Mr.&nbsp;Franklin served as chairman and a director of Boll&eacute;, Inc. from 1997 to 2000, chairman of Lumen Technologies from 1996 to 1998, and as chairman and chief executive officer of its
	predecessor, Benson Eyecare Corporation from 1992 to 1996. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin served on the board of directors of Platform Specialty Products Corporation (&#147;PSPC&#148;) from April 2013 until its acquisition of MacDermid, Incorporated in October
	2013, and continues to serve as the chairman of the combined entity. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin also served on the board of directors of Justice Holdings Ltd (&#147;JHL&#148;) from February 2011 until its business combination with Burger King Worldwide, Inc.
	in June 2012. He served on the board of Burger King Worldwide, Inc. following the business combination from 2012 until its transaction with Tim Hortons, Inc. and the creation of Restaurant Brands International Inc. (&#147;Restaurant Brands&#148;) in
	December 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin is currently serving on the board of Restaurant Brands. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin also served on the board of directors of Liberty Acquisition Holdings Corp. (&#147;LAHC&#148;) from June 2007 until its business combination
	with Grupo Prisa in November 2010, and served on the board of directors of Grupo Prisa from November 2010 to December 2013. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin also served on the board of Liberty Acquisition Holdings International Company (&#147;LAHIC&#148;) from
	January 2008 until its acquisition of Phoenix Group Holdings (formerly known as Pearl Group) in September 2009 and Freedom Acquisition Holdings, Inc. (&#147;Freedom&#148;), from June 2006 until its acquisition of GLG Partners L.P. (&#147;GLG&#148;)
	in November 2007 and continued to serve on the board of directors of GLG until GLG was acquired by the Man Group plc in October 2010. Mr.&nbsp;Franklin also served on the board of directors of Kenneth Cole Productions, Inc. from July 2005 to
	December 2011 and serves as a director and trustee of a number of private companies and charitable institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Noam Gottesman
</I>
</B>
	is
	the founder and Managing Partner of TOMS Capital LLC, which he founded in 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Gottesman was the co-founder of GLG Partners Inc. and its predecessor entities where he served in various chief executive capacities until January 2012.
	Mr.&nbsp;Gottesman served as GLG&#146;s chief executive officer from September 2000 until September 2005, and then as its co-chief executive officer from September 2005 until January 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Gottesman was also chairman of the board of GLG
	following its merger with Freedom and prior to its acquisition by Man Group plc. Mr.&nbsp;Gottesman co-founded GLG as a division of Lehman Brothers International (Europe) in 1995 where he was a Managing Director. Prior to 1995, Mr.&nbsp;Gottesman
	was an executive director of Goldman Sachs International, where he managed global equity portfolios in the private client group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	54
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	John Coyle
</I>
</B>
	is a Partner and Head of Permira North America. Prior to joining Permira in July
	2008, Mr.&nbsp;Coyle served as a Managing Director and Global Head of the Financial Sponsor Group at JPMorgan Securities Inc., where he was responsible for originating and executing transactions for private equity firms in North America, Europe and
	Asia Pacific. He was also a member of JPMorgan&#146;s Investment Bank Management Committee and Private Equity Principal Investments Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Coyle joined JPMorgan in 1988 and held a variety of investment banking positions during his
	tenure. In 1998, Mr.&nbsp;Coyle moved to London to found JPMorgan&#146;s sponsor coverage effort and ultimately build the pre-eminent sponsor franchise in Europe. Mr.&nbsp;Coyle returned to New York in 2005 to head the Global Group, which is a
	leading provider of financial services to the private equity industry. Mr.&nbsp;Coyle currently serves as a director on the board of BakerCorp International, Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Jeremy Isaacs
</I>
</B>
	is a Founding Partner of JRJ Group. At JRJ Group, Mr. Isaacs is closely involved with the implementation and guidance of
	fund strategy, as well as the development and execution of portfolio company strategy. Prior to establishing JRJ Group, in late 2008, Mr. Isaacs held senior executive positions with Lehman Brothers with responsibility for businesses outside North
	America. Mr.&nbsp;Isaacs serves as a non-executive director of both Marex Spectron and Food Freshness Technology. He participates in numerous philanthropic activities, holding a range of positions, including Trustee of The Isaacs Charitable Trust,
	non-executive director of Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust, member of the Bridges Development Fund Advisory Board, and Trustee of the Noah&#146;s Ark Children&#146;s Hospice. Mr.&nbsp;Isaacs is an Honorary Fellow of the London Business School.
	Mr. Isaacs was appointed Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) in the 2015 Queen&#146;s Birthday Honours for his services to the NHS.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	James E. Lillie
</I>
</B>
	is Jarden&#146;s Chief Executive Officer. He joined Jarden in 2003 as Chief Operating Officer and was named President in
	2004 and CEO in June 2011. He brings diverse business and leadership experience across a range of industries and functions enabling him to build both the strategies and operational structures required to sustain reliable growth. From 2000 to 2003,
	Mr.&nbsp;Lillie served as Executive Vice President of Operations at Moore Corporation, Limited. From 1999 to 2000, he served as Executive Vice President of Operations at Walter Industries, Inc., a Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts&nbsp;&amp; Company
	(&#147;KKR&#148;) portfolio company. From 1990 to 1999, Mr.&nbsp;Lillie held a succession of senior level management positions across a variety of disciplines including human resources, manufacturing, finance and operations at World Color, Inc.,
	another KKR portfolio company. Mr.&nbsp;Lillie serves on the board of the US-China Business Council (USBC), a private, nonpartisan, nonprofit organization of American companies that do business in China. The USBC&#146;s mission is to expand the
	US-China commercial relationship to the benefit of its membership and, more broadly, the US economy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Lord Myners
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;is Chancellor
	of the University of Exeter and a member of the Court and Council of the London School of Economics and Political Science.&nbsp;He served as the Financial Services Secretary in Her Majesty&#146;s Treasury, the United Kingdom&#146;s finance ministry,
	from October 2008 to May 2010. Prior to his service at the Treasury, Lord Myners served as chairman or a member of the board of several organizations, including as chairman of Guardian Media Group from 2000 to 2008, director of GLG Partners Inc.
	from 2007 to 2008, Director of Land Securities Group plc from 2006 to 2008 (chairman from 2007 to 2008), chairman of Marks&nbsp;&amp; Spencer plc from 2004 to 2006, and chairman of Aspen Insurance Holdings Ltd from 2002 to 2007. Lord Myners served
	as chairman of PSPC from April 2013 until its business combination with MacDermid, Incorporated in October 2013. He also served as the chairman of JHL, a special purpose acquisition company, from February 2011 until its business combination with
	Burger King Worldwide, Inc. in June 2012. From 1986 to 2001, he served as a director of Gartmore Investment Management Limited. He has also served in an advisory capacity to the United Kingdom Treasury and the United Kingdom Department of
	Trade&nbsp;&amp; Industry, with particular focus on corporate governance practices. Other positions held by Lord Myners have included chairman of the Trustees of Tate, chairman of the Low Pay Commission, a member of the Court of the Bank of England,
	a member of the Investment Board of GIC, Singapore&#146;s sovereign wealth fund. Lord Myners is currently serving as a non-executive director of OJSC Megafon, Ecofin Water&nbsp;&amp; Power Opportunities plc and RIT Capital Partners plc, the
	non-executive chairman of Autonomous Research LLP, chairman and a partner of Cevian Capital LLP and Chairman of Daniel J Edelman (UK). Lord Myners is a graduate, with honors, from University of London and has an honorary doctorate from the
	University of Exeter.&nbsp;He is a Visiting Fellow at Nuffield College, Oxford and an Executive Fellow at London Business School. He is a crossbench member of the UK&#146;s House of Lords, the senior chamber in Parliament.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	55
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Victoria Parry
</I>
</B>
	was Global Head of Product Legal for Man Group plc until April 2013 and now
	acts as an independent non-executive director and consultant to the funds industry.&nbsp;Prior to the merger of Man Group plc with GLG Partners in 2010, she was Senior Legal Counsel for GLG Partners LP.&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Parry joined Lehman Brothers
	International (Europe) in April 1996 where she was Legal Counsel with responsibility for inter alia the activities of the GLG Partners division and left Lehman Brothers in September 2000 upon the establishment of GLG Partners LP.&nbsp;Prior to
	joining Lehman Brothers in 1996 Ms. Parry practiced as a solicitor with a leading London based firm of solicitors.&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Parry graduated from University College Cardiff, with a LLB (Hons) in 1986.&nbsp;Ms. Parry is a solicitor and a member
	of the Law Society of England and Wales.&nbsp;Ms. Parry is a director of a number of other companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Brian Welch
</I>
</B>
	is a Partner in
	Pershing Square Capital Management L.P. (&#147;Pershing Square&#148;), an investment adviser registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Pershing Square is a concentrated, research-intensive, fundamental value investment firm based
	in New York City. Mr.&nbsp;Welch joined Pershing Square in September 2011, and is responsible for identifying, analyzing and monitoring current and prospective investment opportunities across a variety of industries. Before joining Pershing Square,
	Mr.&nbsp;Welch was a private equity analyst at The Blackstone Group from 2008 to 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation of Executive Officers and Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, Nomad Holdings did not have operations or employees and, accordingly, no compensation or benefits were
	paid to officers. As such, this section sets forth for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015: (i)&nbsp;the compensation and benefits provided to our executive officers, (ii)&nbsp;a brief description of the bonus programs in which our
	executive officers participated, and (iii)&nbsp;the total amounts set aside for pension, retirement and similar benefits for our executive officers. This section also describes the Nomad Long Term 2015 Incentive Plan (&#147;LTIP&#148;) including a
	summary of the material terms of the LTIP, a description of current executive employment agreements and equity awards granted thereunder, and a description of our director compensation program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Executive Compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Executive Officer Compensation and Benefits for
	the nine months ended December 31, 2015
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For a description of executive compensation for the nine months ended December 31, 2015, see Notes 8
	&#147;Payroll costs, share based payments and management incentive schemes&#148; and 9 &#147;Directors&#146; and Key Management emoluments&#148; to our audited consolidated financial statements which appear elsewhere in this annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Pension, Retirement and Similar Benefits
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Our executive
	officers who participate in our money purchase pension plans do so on generally the same terms as our other employees. The aggregate amount of the employer contributions to this plan for our executive officers during the nine months ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 was less than
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.1 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Employment
	Agreements
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

	Chief Executive Officer.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;St&eacute;fan Descheemaeker was appointed as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company
	and Iglo and as a Director of the Company effective on June&nbsp;1, 2015. He entered into his Service Agreement with us on June&nbsp;17, 2015. Under the agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker will receive an annual salary of &pound;700,000 that will be
	reviewed, but not necessarily increased, on an annual basis (the first review to take place in 2017). Mr.&nbsp;Descheemaeker is entitled to receive the following benefits under the terms of his agreement:
