	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D171646D20F_HTM_TX171646_208">
</A>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	General information
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad Foods Limited (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Nomad&#148;) was
	incorporated in the British Virgin Islands on April&nbsp;1, 2014. The address of Nomad&#146;s registered office is Nemours Chambers, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad Foods (NYSE: NOMD) is a leading frozen foods company building a global portfolio of best-in-class food companies and brands within the frozen
	category and across the broader food sector. Nomad produces, markets and distributes brands in 15 countries and has the leading market share in Western Europe. The Company&#146;s portfolio of leading frozen food brands includes Birdseye, Iglo, and
	Findus.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Basis of preparation
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The consolidated financial statements of Nomad and its subsidiaries (the
	&#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Nomad&#148;, or the &#147;Successor&#148;) and the consolidated financial statements of Iglo Foods Holdings Limited (the &#147;Predecessor&#148;) have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting
	Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board. These consolidated financial statements are also in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as adopted by the European Union.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On June 1, 2015 Nomad Foods Limited (previously &#147;Nomad Holdings Limited&#148;) acquired Iglo Foods Holding Ltd (the &#147;Iglo Group&#148; and the
	&#147;Iglo Acquisition&#148;). Nomad Foods Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange and Iglo Foods Holdings Limited, a direct subsidiary of Nomad, is considered to be the &#147;Predecessor&#148; of Nomad Foods Limited (the
	&#147;Successor&#148;), as prior to the Iglo Acquisition, Nomad Foods Limited had no operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 2, 2015 the Company acquired Findus
	Sverige AB and its subsidiaries (the &#147;Findus Group&#148; and the &#147;Findus Acquisition&#148;). The acquired business included operations across continental Europe with leading market positions in France, Sweden and Spain along with the
	intellectual and commercialization rights to the Findus, Lutosa (until 2020) and La Cocinera brands in their respective markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There are no new
	accounting standards adopted which have a material impact on these financial statements.&nbsp;Refer to 3.19 for more information on new IFRSs not yet adopted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s financial statements and notes are presented in the reporting currency of millions of Euros. Upon the acquisition of the Iglo Group
	on June 1, 2015, Nomad changed its functional currency from U.S. dollars to the Euros because this is the functional currency of the Iglo Group, which comprises all of Nomad&#146;s operations. All financial information has been rounded to the
	nearest
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.1 million, except where otherwise indicated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On May 28, 2015 the Company changed its year end reporting date from March&nbsp;31 to December&nbsp;31 to align with the historical reporting calendar
	of the Iglo Group.&nbsp;This change has no impact on the financial statements and notes included herein.&nbsp;Fiscal year 2015 is a nine month period for the Company, which might not be comparable to the comparative amounts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The consolidated financial statements were approved for issuance by the Board of Directors of Nomad Foods Limited on March 30, 2016.&nbsp;The Directors
	have, at the time of approving the financial statements, a reasonable expectation that Nomad has adequate resources to continue in operational existence for the foreseeable future given the cash funds available and the current forecast cash
	outflows.&nbsp;Thus, Nomad continues to adopt the going concern basis of accounting in preparing the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Accounting policies
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The accounting policies set out below have, unless otherwise stated, been
	applied consistently.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Judgments made by the Directors in the application of these accounting policies that have a significant effect on the
	financial statements and key sources of estimation uncertainty which have a significant risk of causing a material adjustment in the next year are discussed in Note 4.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.1
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Measurement Convention
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The financial statements are prepared on the historical
	cost basis with the exception of derivative financial instruments, business combinations, share based payments, and founder preferred shares which are stated at fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.2
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Business Combination
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company uses the acquisition method to account for
	business combinations.&nbsp;The consideration transferred for the acquisition of a subsidiary is the fair value of the assets transferred, the liabilities incurred and the equity interest issued by the Company.&nbsp;The consideration transferred
	includes the fair value of any asset or liability resulting from a contingent consideration arrangement.&nbsp;Identifiable assets acquired and liabilities and contingent liabilities assumed in a business combination are measured initially at their
	fair values at the acquisition date.&nbsp;Acquisition-related costs are expensed as incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Where selling shareholders have
	contractually agreed to indemnify Nomad Foods Limited for contingent liabilities, an indemnification asset is recognized equivalent to the fair value of the liability recognized by Nomad.&nbsp;The indemnification asset is deducted from consideration
	transferred for the business combination. The indemnification asset value will subsequently be revised where revisions are made to the fair value of the liability or where there are doubts over the ability to recover losses from the selling
	shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.3
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Basis of consolidation
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The consolidated financial statements include the
	accounts of the Company and its wholly owned subsidiaries.&nbsp;Intercompany balances and transactions, and any unrealized income and expenses arising from intra-group transactions are eliminated.&nbsp;Accounting policies are applied consistently
	across the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subsidiaries are all entities (including structured entities) over which Nomad has control; directly or
	indirectly.&nbsp;The Company controls an entity when the Company is exposed to, or has rights to, variable returns from its involvement with the entity and has the ability to affect those returns through its power over the entity.&nbsp;Subsidiaries
	are fully consolidated from the date on which control is transferred to the Company.&nbsp;They are deconsolidated from the date that control ceases.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.4
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Foreign currency
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Foreign currency transactions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Transactions in foreign currencies (currencies other
	than the functional currency) are translated into the functional currency at the foreign exchange rate ruling at the date of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated into the functional
	currency at the foreign exchange rate ruling the financial year end. Foreign exchange gains and losses resulting from the settlement of such transactions and from the translation of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies
	at year end exchange rates are generally recognized in profit or loss. They are deferred in equity if they relate to qualifying cash flow hedges, qualifying net investment hedges or are attributable to part of a net investment in a foreign
	operation. Foreign exchange gains and losses that relate to these assets and liabilities are presented in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss within &#147;finance income or costs&#148;, except when hedge accounting applies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Non-monetary assets and liabilities in a foreign currency are translated into the
	functional currency to establish historical cost, using the exchange rate at the date of the transaction.&nbsp;Non-monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies that are stated at fair value are translated at foreign exchange
	rates ruling at the date the fair value was determined.&nbsp;Translation differences on assets and liabilities carried at fair value are reported as part of the fair value gain or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The revenues and expenses of foreign operations are translated at an average rate for the period (unless this is not a reasonable
	approximation of the cumulative effect of the rates prevailing on the transaction dates, which case income and expenses are translated at the dates of the transaction).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Assets and liabilities of foreign operations
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the purposes of presenting
	consolidated financial statements, the assets and liabilities of foreign operations, including goodwill and fair value adjustments arising on consolidation, are translated at foreign exchange rates ruling at the financial period ended December 31,
	2015 of &pound;1:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.36 (2014: &pound;1:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.28). The revenues and
	expenses of foreign operations are translated at an average rate for the period where this rate approximates to the foreign exchange rates ruling at the dates of the transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Foreign exchange gains and losses that relate to these assets and liabilities are presented in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or
	Loss within &#145;finance income or costs&#146;, except where hedge accounting applies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Net investment in foreign operations
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Exchange differences arising from the translation
	of foreign operations and of related qualifying hedges are taken directly to the translation reserve within equity.&nbsp;They are realized through the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss upon disposal of the related foreign operation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.5
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Goodwill
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Goodwill represents amounts arising on acquisition of
	subsidiaries.&nbsp;Goodwill is the difference between the cost of the acquisition and the fair value of the net identifiable assets acquired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Goodwill is stated at cost less any accumulated impairment losses.&nbsp;Gains and losses on the disposal of an entity include the
	carrying amount of goodwill relating to the entity sold.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Goodwill is allocated to the cash-generating unit and is not monitored
	below the operating segment unit. Goodwill is not amortized but is tested annually for impairment.&nbsp;Refer to 3.7 for discussion on cash-generating units.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.6
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Other intangible assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Intangible assets acquired separately are recorded at
	cost and those acquired as part of a business combination are recorded at fair value as at the date of acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Computer software
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Capitalized software costs include the cost of acquired computer
	software licenses and costs that are directly associated with the design, construction and testing of such software where this relates to a major business system.&nbsp;Costs associated with identifying, sourcing, evaluating or maintaining computer
	software are recognized as an expense as incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The assets are stated at cost less accumulated amortization and impairment losses.
	Software costs are amortized by equal monthly installments over their estimated useful economic life of five to seven years once the software is capable of being brought into use.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Brands
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Based on the market position of the brands, the significant levels of
	investment in advertising and promoting the brands, and the fact that they have been established for over 50 years, the Directors consider that the Birds Eye, Iglo and Findus brands have indefinite lives. Therefore these brands are not amortized,
	but instead held at historical cost less provision for any impairment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The La Cocinera and Lutosa brands are deemed to not have an
	indefinite life and are being amortized over 10 and 6 years respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Customer relationships
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Long standing Food Service customer relationships have been
	identified as intangible assets as part of the Findus Acquisition.&nbsp;These are deemed to not have an indefinite life and are being amortized over 14 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.7
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Impairment of non-current assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The carrying amounts of the Company&#146;s
	non-current assets are reviewed annually to determine whether there is any indication of impairment. If any such indication exists, the asset&#146;s recoverable amount is estimated. Impairment losses are recognized in the Consolidated Statement of
	Profit or Loss in the period in which they arise. For goodwill and assets that have an indefinite useful life an impairment review is performed at least annually.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Assets that are subject to amortization are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the net
	carrying amount may not be recoverable.&nbsp;An impairment loss is recognized whenever the carrying amount of an asset or its cash-generating unit exceeds its recoverable amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Calculation of recoverable amount
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Recoverable amount is the greater of fair value less
	costs to sell and value in use.&nbsp;In assessing value in use, the estimated future cash flows of the business are discounted to their present value using a discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the
	risks specific to the asset.&nbsp;For an asset that does not generate largely independent cash inflows, the recoverable amount is determined for the cash-generating unit to which the asset belongs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Allocation of impairment losses
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Impairment losses recognized in respect of
	cash-generating units are allocated first to reduce the carrying amount of any goodwill allocated to cash-generating units then to reduce the carrying amount of the other assets in the unit on a pro rata basis.&nbsp;A cash generating unit is the
	smallest identifiable group of assets that generates cash inflows that are largely independent of the cash inflows from other assets or groups of assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-11
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Reversals of impairment
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	An impairment loss in respect of goodwill is not reversed. In
	respect of other assets, an impairment loss is reversed when there is an indication that the impairment loss may no longer exist and there has been a change in the estimates used to determine the recoverable amount. An impairment loss is reversed
	only to the extent that the asset&#146;s carrying amount does not exceed the carrying amount that would have been determined, net of depreciation or amortization, if no impairment loss had been recognized.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.8
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Property, plant and equipment
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Owned assets
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Property, plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated
	depreciation and impairment losses.&nbsp;Cost includes the original purchase price of the asset and the costs attributable to bringing the asset to its working condition for its intended use.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Where parts of an item of property, plant and equipment have different useful lives, they are accounted for as separate items of
	property, plant and equipment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Leased assets
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Leases in which the Company assumes substantially all the risks and
	rewards of ownership of the leased asset are classified as &#145;finance leases&#146;. Where land and buildings are held under finance leases the accounting treatment of the land is considered separately from that of the buildings. Leased assets
	acquired by way of finance lease are stated at an amount equal to the lower of their fair value and the present value of the minimum lease payments at inception of the lease, less accumulated depreciation and impairment losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All other leases are classified as &#145;operating leases&#146;.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Depreciation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Depreciation is charged to the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss
	on a straight line basis over the shorter of the lease term and the estimated useful lives of each part of an item of property, plant and equipment once the item is brought into use.&nbsp;Land is not depreciated.&nbsp;The estimated useful lives are
	as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Buildings 40 years
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Plant and equipment 5 to 14 years
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Computer equipment 3 to 5 years
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The assets&#146; residual values and useful lives are
	reviewed on a frequent basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.9
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Inventories
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Inventories are stated at the lower of cost and net realizable
	value.&nbsp;Cost is based on the weighted average principle and includes expenditure incurred in acquiring the inventories and bringing them to their existing location and condition.&nbsp;Inventories that are acquired through business combinations
	are fair valued at the time of acquisition.&nbsp;In the case of manufactured inventories and work in progress, cost includes an appropriate share of direct costs and overheads based on normal operating capacity.&nbsp;Provision is made for slow
	moving, obsolete and defective inventories.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-12
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.10
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee benefits
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Defined contribution plans
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Obligations for contributions to defined contribution
	pension plans are recognized as an expense in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss as incurred.&nbsp;Prepaid contributions are recognized as an asset to the extent that a cash refund or reduction in the future payments is available.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Defined benefit plans
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s net obligation in respect of defined benefit
	pension plans and other post-employment benefits is calculated separately for each plan by estimating the amount of future benefit that employees have earned in return for their service in the current and prior periods. That net obligation is
	discounted to determine its present value. The calculation is performed by a qualified actuary using the projected unit credit method.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The current service cost of the defined benefit plan, recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss in employee benefit
	expense, except where included in the cost of an asset, reflects the increase in the defined benefit obligation resulting from employee service in the current year, benefit changes, curtailments and settlements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Actuarial gains and losses arising from experience adjustments and changes in actuarial assumptions are charged or credited to equity
	in other comprehensive income in the period in which they arise.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The net interest cost is calculated by applying the discount rate
	to the net balance of the defined benefit obligation and the fair value of plan assets.&nbsp;This cost is included in employee benefit expense in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Past service cost is recognized immediately.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Share based payment schemes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Schemes fall within the provisions of IFRS 2 &#147;Share
	Based Payments&#148; and represent equity settled share based payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A charge is taken to the Consolidated Statement of Profit
	or Loss for the difference between the fair value of the shares at grant date and the amount subscribed, spread over the vesting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Non-market vesting conditions are included in assumptions about the number of awards that are expected to vest.&nbsp;The total expense
	is recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss with a corresponding credit to equity over the vesting period, which is the period over which all of the specified vesting conditions are to be satisfied.&nbsp;At the end of each
	reporting period, the entity revises its estimates of the number of awards that are expected to vest based on the non-market vesting conditions.&nbsp;It recognizes the impact of the revision to original estimates, if any, in the Consolidated
	Statement of Profit or Loss, with a corresponding adjustment to equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Nomad Foods 2015 Long Term Incentive Plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Long Term Incentive Plan (&#147;LTIP&#148;) is discretionary and enables the Company&#146;s Compensation Committee to make grants
	(&#147;Awards&#148;) in the form of rights over ordinary shares, to any Director or employee of the Company, although the current intention of the Committee is that Awards be granted only to Directors and senior management. The first Award under
	this Scheme was granted on January 1, 2016 as set out in Note 39.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-13
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad has calculated the cost of the Initial Options based upon their fair value and
	taking into account the vesting period and using the Black-Scholes methodology.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Predecessor
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At the end of each reporting period, the Iglo Group revised its estimates of the number of interests that were expected to vest based
	on the non-market vesting conditions.&nbsp;It recognized the impact of the revision to original estimates, if any, in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss, with a corresponding adjustment to equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Other management incentive schemes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If schemes fall outside the scope of IFRS 2, since
	they are not related to the price or value of equity instruments, but do fall within the scope of IAS 19 &#147;Employee Benefits&#148;, an annual charge is taken over the service period based on an estimate of the amount of future benefit employees
	will earn in return for their service.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.11
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Founder Preferred Shares
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad issued Founder Preferred Shares to both TOMS
	Acquisition I, LLC and Mariposa Acquisition II, LLC (collectively the &#147;Founder Entities&#148;) in connection with its initial public offering in April 2014. Holders of the Founder Preferred Shares are entitled to receive annual dividend amounts
	subject to certain performance conditions (the &#147;Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount&#148;). The instrument and its component parts were analyzed under IFRS 2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition to the right to receive the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount, the Founder Preferred Shares give the holder
	the same entitlements as a holder of Ordinary Shares. As the cash consideration received for this equity entitlement was the same price as the Company&#146;s initial public offering in April 2014, the Founder Preferred Share reserve amount is
	outside the scope of IFRS 2 and is classified as equity in accordance with IAS 32.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Prior to the acquisition of the Iglo Group on
	June 1, 2015, Nomad classified the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount as a liability at fair value, calculated using a Monte Carlo simulation. As the Founder Preferred Shares were issued to affiliates of certain of the non-executive
	directors of Nomad, the fair value of the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount given to the holders was recorded as an expense. There are no further service conditions attached and the expense was recognized immediately. Subsequent to its
	initial recognition when issued, the liability was adjusted for changes in fair value. Changes in value were recorded in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss through June 1, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Upon completion of the acquisition of the Iglo Group on June 1, 2015, the Company intended that the Founder Preferred Shares Annual
	Dividend Amount would be equity settled. Accordingly, the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount as of June 1, 2015 of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	531.5 million (the
	&#147;Founder Preferred Shares Dividend reserve&#148;) was classified as equity and no further revaluations will be required or recorded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Should a Founder Preferred Share Annual Dividend Amount become due and payable, the market value of any dividend paid will be deducted
	from the Founder Preferred Shares Dividend reserve, with any excess deducted from the accumulated profit/(deficit) reserve within Equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.12
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Provisions
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Provisions are recognized when the Company has a legal or
	constructive present obligation as a result of a past event and it is probable that the Company will be required to settle that obligation. Provisions are measured at the Directors&#146; best estimate of the expenditure required to settle the
	obligation at the financial year end date and are discounted to present value where the effect is material.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-14
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.13
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Financial instruments
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Financial assets and liabilities are recognized in the
	Company&#146;s Statement of Financial Position when the Company becomes a party to the contractual provisions of the instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Trade receivables
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade receivables are measured at initial recognition at fair value
	and are subsequently measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method, less any impairment.&nbsp;Since trade receivables are due within one year, this equates to initial carrying value less any impairment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Appropriate allowances for estimated irrecoverable amounts are recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss when there is
	objective evidence that the asset is impaired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade receivables are presented net of customer rebate balances.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Cash and cash equivalents
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Cash and cash equivalents comprise cash balances and call
	deposits. Bank overdrafts that are repayable on demand and form an integral part of the Company&#146;s cash management are included as a component of cash and cash equivalents for the purpose of the Statement of Cash Flows only.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Loans and borrowings
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Valuation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Interest bearing borrowings are recognized initially at fair value less
	attributable transaction costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subsequent to initial recognition, interest bearing loans and borrowings are stated at amortized
	cost with any difference between cost and redemption value being recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss over the expected period of the borrowings on a straight line basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Capitalization of transaction costs
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Fees paid on the establishment of loan facilities
	are recognized as transaction costs of the loan to the extent that it is probable that some or all of the facility will be drawn down.&nbsp;In this case, the fee is deferred until the draw-down occurs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	To the extent there is no evidence that it is probable that some or all of the facility will be drawn down the fee is capitalized as a
	pre-payment for liquidity services and amortized over the period of the facility to which it relates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Trade payables
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade payables are measured at initial recognition at fair value and
	are subsequently measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method.&nbsp;Since trade payables are largely due within one year, this equates to initial carrying value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-15
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Derivative financial instruments and hedge accounting
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Derivative financial instruments
	are recognized at fair value.&nbsp;When a derivative financial instrument is not designated in a hedge relationship that qualifies for hedge accounting, all changes in its fair value are recognized immediately in the Consolidated Statement of Profit
	or Loss.&nbsp;However, where derivatives qualify for hedge accounting, recognition of any resultant gain or loss depends on the nature of the item being hedged.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of interest rate caps represents the time value plus the intrinsic value at the financial year end date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of forward exchange contracts is determined using forward exchange rates at the balance sheet date, with the resulting
	value discounted back to present value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Cash flow hedges
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Where a derivative financial instrument is designated as a hedge of
	the variability in cash flows of a recognized asset or liability, or a highly probable forecast transaction, the effective part of any gain or loss on the derivative financial instrument is recognized directly in the cash flow hedging
	reserve.&nbsp;Any ineffective portion of the hedge is recognized immediately in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	When
	a hedging instrument expires or is sold, terminated or exercised, or the entity revokes designation of the hedge relationship but the hedged forecast transaction is still expected to occur, the cumulative gain or loss at that point remains in equity
	and is recognized when the transaction occurs.&nbsp;If the hedged transaction is no longer expected to take place, the cumulative unrealized gain or loss recognized in equity is recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss immediately.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Net investment hedges
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Foreign currency differences arising on the retranslation of a
	financial liability designated as a hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation are recognized in Other Comprehensive Income to the extent that the hedge is effective, and are presented in the translation reserve within equity.&nbsp;To the
	extent that the hedge is ineffective, such differences are recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss.&nbsp;When the hedged net investment is disposed of, the relevant amount in the translation reserve is transferred to the
	Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss as part of the gain or loss on disposal.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Portfolio investments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:26%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	From time to time, Nomad invests in short-term highly liquid
	investments that are readily convertible into known amounts of cash and have a maturity of more than 3 months and less than one year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.14
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Revenue
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revenue comprises sales of goods after deduction of discounts, sales
	taxes and excludes intra-Company sales.&nbsp;Discounts given by the Company include rebates, price reductions and incentives given to customers, promotional couponing and trade communication costs.&nbsp;At each financial year end date any discount
	incurred, but not yet invoiced, is estimated and accrued.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revenue is recognized when the title and risk of loss of the underlying
	products have been transferred to the customer, at which point the sale price is fixed or determinable. This completes the revenue-earning process specifically that an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred, ownership has transferred, the price
	is determined and collectability is reasonably assured. The timing of the transfer of risks and rewards varies depending on the individual terms of the sales agreement, usually being on dispatch and ensured receipt of goods by the customer. A
	provision for payment discounts and product return allowances, which is estimated based upon the Company&#146;s historical performance, management&#146;s experience and current economic trends, is recorded as a reduction of sales in the same period
	that the revenue is recognized.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-16
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage104"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade promotions, consisting primarily of customer pricing allowances and merchandising
	funds and customer coupons are offered through various programs to customers and consumers. Sales are recorded net of estimated trade promotion spending, which is recognized as incurred at the time of sale. Certain retailers require the payment of
	slotting fees in order to obtain space for the Company&#146;s products on the retailers&#146; store shelves. The fees are recognized as reductions of revenue on the date a liability to the retailer is created. These amounts are included in the
	determination of net sales. Accruals for expected pay-outs under these programs are included as accrued trade marketing expense in the Statement of Financial Position. Coupon redemption costs are also recognized as reductions of net sales when the
	coupons are issued. Estimates of trade promotion expense and coupon redemption costs are based upon programs offered, timing of those offers, estimated redemption/usage rates from historical performance, management&#146;s expense and current
	economic trends.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade marketing expense is comprised of amounts paid to retailers for programs designed to promote our products
	and are classified in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss as a reduction of net sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.15
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Interest income
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Interest income is recognized in the Consolidated Statement of
	Profit or Loss in the period in which it is earned.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.16
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Expenses
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Operating lease payments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Payments made under operating leases are recognized in the
	Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss on a straight line basis over the term of the lease.&nbsp;Lease incentives received are recognized on a straight line basis in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss as an integral part of the total
	lease expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Borrowing costs
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Unless capitalized as part of the cost of borrowing (see Note
	3.13(iii)), borrowing costs are recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss in the period in which they are incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Exceptional items
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The separate reporting of exceptional items which are presented as
	exceptional within the relevant Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss category, helps provide an indication of the Company&#146;s underlying business performance. Exceptional items have been identified and adjusted by virtue of their size, nature
	or incidence. In determining whether an event or transaction is specific, management considers quantitative as well as qualitative factors such as the frequency or predictability of occurrence. Exceptional items comprise restructuring costs,
	impairments or reversal of impairments of intangible assets, operational restructuring, integration and acquisition costs relating to new acquisitions, investigation of strategic opportunities, costs relating to certain management incentive plans
	and other significant items (see Note 7).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-17
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Research and development
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Expenditure on research activities is recognized in the
	Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss as an expense as incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.17
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Taxation
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Tax on the profit or loss for the year comprises current and deferred
	tax.&nbsp;Tax is recognized in the Income Statement except to the extent that it relates to items recognized directly in equity, in which case it is recognized in equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Current tax is the expected tax payable on the taxable income for the year, using tax rates enacted or substantively enacted at the
	financial year end date, and any adjustment to tax payable in respect of previous years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Deferred tax is provided on temporary
	differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities recognized for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for taxation purposes on an undiscounted basis.&nbsp;The following temporary differences are not provided
	for:&nbsp;the initial recognition of goodwill; the initial recognition of assets or liabilities that affect neither accounting nor taxable profit other than in a business combination, and differences relating to investments in subsidiaries to the
	extent that they will probably not reverse in the foreseeable future.&nbsp;The amount of deferred tax provided is based on the expected manner of realization or settlement of the carrying amount of assets and liabilities, using tax rates enacted or
	substantively enacted at the financial year end date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A deferred tax asset is recognized only to the extent that it is probable
	that future taxable profits will be available against which the asset can be utilized.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.18
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Segment reporting
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Chief Operating Decision Maker (&#147;CODM&#148;) has been
	determined to be the Chief Executive Officer as he is primarily responsible for the allocation of resources to the segments and the assessment of performance of the segments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Following the Iglo Group acquisition, Nomad&#146;s operations were organized into one operating unit, &#145;Frozen&#146;, which
	comprises all the brands, as well as the factories, private label business units and certain corporate overheads. The subsequent business acquired in the Findus Acquisition was incorporated into the Company&#146;s management structure and is
	reported within the Frozen segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The CODM uses revenue and earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortization,
	exceptional items, acquisition accounting adjustments and charges related to Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount, warranty redemption and other similar items (&#147;Adjusted EBITDA&#148;) as the key measure of the segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.19
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	IFRSs not yet adopted
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At the date of authorization of these financial
	statements, the following Standards and Interpretations, which have not been applied in the financial statements, were in issue but not yet effective:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_23"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	IFRS 9 &#145;Financial instruments&#146; addresses the classification, measurement and recognition of financial assets and financial liabilities and replaces IAS 39. IFRS 9 will become effective for the accounting
	periods starting on January 1, 2018.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	IFRS 15 &#145;Revenue from contracts with customers&#146; will become effective for accounting periods starting on January 1, 2018.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
