	IFRS 16 &#145;Leases&#146; will become effective for accounting periods starting on January 1, 2019.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-18
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Directors anticipate that the adoption in future periods of IFRS 9 and IFRS 15, where
	they are relevant to the Company, will have no material impact on the consolidated financial statements of the Company, although this assessment is ongoing.&nbsp;The Company is still assessing IFRS 16.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Accounting estimates
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The key sources of estimation uncertainty at the financial year end date
	are discussed below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Discounts and trade marketing expense
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Discounts given by the Company include rebates,
	price reductions and incentives given to customers, promotional couponing and trade communication costs.&nbsp;Each customer has a unique agreement that is governed by a combination of observable and unobservable performance conditions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At each financial year end date any discount incurred but not yet invoiced is estimated, based on historical trends and rebate contracts
	with customers, and accrued as &#145;trade terms&#146;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade marketing expense is comprised of amounts paid to retailers for
	programs designed to promote Company products. The ultimate costs of these programs will depend upon retailer performance and is the subject of significant management estimates. The Company records as an expense, the estimated ultimate cost of the
	program in the period during which the program occurs and is based upon the programs offered, timing of those offers, estimated retailer performance based on history, management&#146;s expense and current economic trends.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Business Combinations
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company is required to recognize separately, at the
	acquisition date, the identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities acquired or assumed in a business combination at their fair values, which involves estimates.&nbsp;Such estimates are based on valuation techniques, which require
	considerable judgment in forecasting future cash flows and developing other assumptions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Carrying value of goodwill and brands
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Determining whether goodwill and brands are
	impaired requires an estimation of the value in use of the cash generating unit to which goodwill and brands have been allocated.&nbsp;The value in use calculation requires the entity to estimate the future cash flows expected to arise from the cash
	generating unit and a suitable discount rate in order to calculate present value.&nbsp;Details of impairment reviews are provided in Note 13.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Employee benefit obligation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A significant number of estimates are required to calculate
	the fair value of the retirement benefit obligation at year end.&nbsp;Note 23 contains details of these assumptions and the calculation is performed by qualified actuaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income tax
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Where tax exposures can be quantified, an accrual is made based on best
	estimates and management&#146;s judgments. Given the inherent uncertainties in assessing the outcomes of these exposures (which can sometimes be binary in nature), the Company could in future periods experience adjustments to these accruals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-19
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Fair value of derivative financial instruments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Note 34 includes details of the fair
	value of the derivative instruments that the Company holds at each balance sheet period.&nbsp;Management has estimated the fair value of these instruments by using valuations based on discounted cash flow calculations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	g)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Share based payments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At the end of each reporting period, the Company, in estimating
	its share based payment charge, assesses and revises its estimates of the number of interests that are expected to vest based on the non-market vesting conditions.&nbsp;Note 8 contains details of these assumptions and of the valuation model used.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	h)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Founder Preferred Shares
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amounts were
	valued and recognized as a liability under IFRS 2.&nbsp;The fair value of the liability at each balance sheet date was valued using a Monte Carlo simulation and any difference in fair value was recorded as an expense from April&nbsp;1, 2014 through
	June&nbsp;1, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The payment of the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount is mandatory after January&nbsp;1, 2015 if
	certain performance conditions are met.&nbsp;Nomad, at its discretion, may settle the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount by issuing shares or by cash payment, but intends to equity settle.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-20
</P>

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>

</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Following the Iglo and Findus acquisitions by Nomad, the CODM of the Company
	considers there to be one reporting and operating segment, being &#145;Frozen Foods&#146; and is reflected in the segment presentation below for the periods presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Historical financial information of the predecessor has been re-presented as if it was one single operating segment for comparative purposes.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Successor&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	9 Months
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	&nbsp;ended&nbsp;Dec&nbsp;31&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	&#128;m
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD ROWSPAN="2" NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</P>

	No information on segment assets or liabilities is presented to the CODM.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Product information
</I>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Management considers the
	products it sells belong to one category, being &#145;Frozen Foods&#146;.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Non-current assets exclude deferred tax assets, goodwill and brands which are not bound to one geographical
	area.&nbsp;The 2014 Predecessor information has been restated to exclude goodwill and brands which had previously been allocated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	F-22
</P>

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	6)

	Operating (loss)/profit

	Operating (loss)/profit is stated after charging:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	919.5&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-23
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the five months ended May 31, 2015 the Iglo Group incurred a charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.8 million in relation to acquisition and sale transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2014, a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.7 million charge was incurred (2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	20.9 million) relating to the payment of registration tax assessed as a result of the CSI (Findus Italy) acquisition. The Iglo Group appealed the rulings and
	elected to pay the assessed taxes in order to avoid incurring penalties and interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(2)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company incurred charges of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.6 million in relation to the investigation of strategic opportunities and other costs in the nine months ended December 31, 2015. This includes an initial spend of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	7.7 million relating to the implementation of the Nomad strategic vision across the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the five months ended May
	31, 2015 and year ended December 31, 2014 the Iglo Group incurred charges of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.3&nbsp;million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	17.4 million respectively, in relation to a strategic review of the Iglo Group&#146;s operations and other items. In 2014, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	17.4 million charges include costs incurred as a result of the decision to cease marketing its products in Romania, Slovakia and Turkey on November 27,
	2014 amounts in relation to tax matters from previous accounting periods and costs related to the implementation of the Better Meals Together strategy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2013,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.2 million was incurred in relation to costs
	arising from the development and implementation of the Better Meals Together Strategy which launched in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Costs related to planned restructuring activities in the German, UK and Italian
	factories were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.9 million in the nine months ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the year ended December 31,
	2014 the Iglo Group incurred restructuring costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.6 million, principally in the German factories. In the year ended December 31, 2013 the Iglo Group
	incurred restructuring costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.5 million principally in the Italian factory.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Following the acquisition of the Findus Group on November 2, 2015, the Company has
	initiated a substantial integration project. Costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.5 million have incurred in the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Management participated in certain incentive schemes for which the Company incurred
	charges of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.5 million in the nine months ended December 31, 2015. To refer to Note 8 for more details on the management incentive scheme.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Iglo Acquisition on June 1,
	2015 was a triggering event under the main incentive schemes following which the majority of management incentive schemes provisions were paid.&nbsp;The completion of the sale was a triggering event under the cash settled schemes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	19.7 million in the five months ended May 31,
	2015 represented an accelerated charge to align the cumulative charges recognized to the amount that was paid in June 2015. In addition, as a result of the terms of the sale, vesting of the equity settled share based payment scheme was accelerated.
	The non-cash charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.2 million in the five months ended May 31, 2015 reflects the vesting of non-forfeited interests in this scheme. There were no
	associated exercises made in relation to the scheme due to the fact that market performance conditions were not met.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-24
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In relation to long-term management incentive plans, the Iglo Group incurred charges of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	16.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	13.8
	million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(6)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As a result of circumstances identified during the five months ended May&nbsp;31,
	2015 it was noted that the recoverable amount of the Italian intangible assets held prior to the Iglo Acquisition were lower than the values previously carried in the Iglo accounts. Therefore the carrying values were adjusted and an impairment
	charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	55.0 million was recognized in the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2013 an impairment charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	27.4 million was
	recognized, which represented a full write down of the goodwill of the Belgium operation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company recognized a net income
	of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.5 million in relation to the August 2014 fire insurance claim in the Italian production facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 and the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015, the Iglo Group incurred charges of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5.5 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.3 million, respectively, in relation to a fire in August 2014 in the Italian production facility which produces Findus branded stock for sale in Italy. The
	charges include the cost of stock damaged by the fire, the impairment of property as well as ongoing incremental costs incurred as a result of the disruption to operations. The Company has insurance policies in place covering the stock, property and
	loss of earnings for which claims are currently in process. The proceeds of these claims cannot be recognized until the recoverable amount is judged to be virtually certain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The tax impact on the exceptional items amounts to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.1
	million in the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 (the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	22.0 million; the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	7.8 million; the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.4 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	exclude long term management incentive scheme and share based payment costs, but includes bonus costs, in particular those associated with a bonus issuance scheme for key management employees, resulting in the purchase of 13,104 Ordinary shares of
	the Company on November&nbsp;27, 2015.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Non-Executive Restricted Stock Awards
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In relation to the Non-Executive Directors&#146; annual restricted stock grant issued under the 2015 LTIP, a charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.1 million was recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss for the nine month period to December&nbsp;31, 2015. The charge was based upon the
	right for each
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Executive
</FONT>
	Director to receive $100,000 of ordinary shares of the Company, fair valued at an $11.50 closing market price for such shares on the Award grant date of December&nbsp;7, 2015
	vesting over the period to the annual meeting date of shareholders to be held in June 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	2015 LTIP
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The first Award (excluding the above) under the Company&#146;s 2015 LTIP Scheme was granted on January&nbsp;1, 2016 and as such no
	costs have been accounted for within these financial statements. See Note&nbsp;39.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Initial Options
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On April&nbsp;11, 2014 Lord Myners, Alun Cathcart and Guy Yamen, all Non-Executive Directors, were granted options (&#147;Initial
	Options&#148;) to purchase a maximum of 125,000 Ordinary Shares at an exercise price of $11.50 per ordinary share (subject to such adjustment to the number of Ordinary Shares and/or the exercise price as the Directors consider appropriate in
	accordance with the terms of the Initial Option Deeds in respect of an issue of Ordinary Shares by way of a dividend or distribution to holders of Ordinary Shares, a subdivision or consolidation or any other variation to the share capital of Nomad,
	as determined by the Directors).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The awards will be exercisable during the five year period commencing on the trading day
	immediately following the date Nomad completes an acquisition.&nbsp;Nomad has calculated the cost of the Initial Options based upon their fair value and taking into account the vesting period and using the Black-Scholes methodology.&nbsp;The
	valuation of the Initial Options has been based on the following assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	market value of Ordinary Shares at the grant date of $10.00;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-26
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Such securities and awards have been accounted for in accordance with &#147;IFRS
	2&#151;Share Based Payment&#148;. Based on the preceding assumptions, the total value for the Initial Options is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.06 million. There are no expected
	forfeitures at grant date and the expense is recognized over an estimated 2-year period ended on April&nbsp;1, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In prior years for the Predecessor, certain employees of the Predecessor were offered the opportunity to participate in one of several
	Predecessor share schemes through which they could subscribe for shares of the Permira Partnership, the ultimate controlling party of the Predecessor. These schemes were accounted for under IFRS 2 &#147;Share Based Payments&#148; and represented
	equity settled share based payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Due to the sale of the Iglo Group, the vesting of the equity settled share based payment
	scheme was accelerated. The resulting
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.2 million charge to the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015,
	reflected the accelerated vesting of non-forfeited interests in the scheme. Share-based payment charges for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.7
	million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 respectively. The plans were equity settled.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2013 a predecessor plan granted certain classes of interests in the Permira Partnership to key employees, including Executive
	Management. The total number of interests awarded was 636,070 at a weighted fair value of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.09. The fair value of these interests was estimated at the
	date of grant using a Monte Carlo simulation option pricing model incorporated expected volatility and risk-free interest rates. No dividends were expected to be paid and so were not incorporated into the model. The employee was not free to sell the
	shares until a sale, asset sale or listing of the Predecessor.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Management incentive schemes
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subsequent to the sale of Iglo and specific to the terms of a Predecessor incentive scheme,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.5 million was charged to the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss during the nine month period to December&nbsp;31, 2015. There were no other incentive schemes for the nine month period to
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Certain members of the Predecessor&#146;s management team previously participated in certain incentive schemes. The completion of the
	sale of the Iglo Group to the Company on June&nbsp;1, 2015 was a triggering event under the cash settled schemes. The resulting
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	19.7 million charge to the
	Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss for the five months ended May&nbsp;31, 2015, reflected the acceleration of the charges to align the cumulative charges recognized to the amount that was paid in June 2015. Management incentive scheme charges
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	18.6 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	11.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-27
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage115"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All significant management decision making authority is vested within the Board of Directors and the executive team,
	therefore key management are considered to be the Directors and executive Officers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	None of the executive Officers were accruing benefits under long
	term incentive schemes during the period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Predecessor Non-Executive Directors were paid through payroll and are included within the table above but
	were not disclosed separately.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In all predecessor periods, there were 8 directors in respect of whose qualifying services shares were received under
	long term incentive schemes, including the highest paid director.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A one-off charge of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	37.9 million was incurred as a consequence of the refinancing in July 2014. Of this, deferred transaction costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	34.5 million relating to the previous senior debt were written off.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Effective tax rates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The effective tax rate for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 was 3.5%.&nbsp;Effective from and including January 12, 2016, the Company become a
	resident in the United Kingdom for United Kingdom tax purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the year ended March&nbsp;31 2015, the Company has not been subject to income
	tax or corporation tax in the British Virgin Islands.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The effective tax rate for 2014 was 62.1% and 5.1% for 2013.&nbsp;The decrease is principally caused by the impact of the reduction in the UK and
	Italian corporate tax rates on deferred tax balances, as well as the impact of expenses which are not tax deductible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company operates in many
	different jurisdictions and in some of these, certain matters are under discussion with local tax authorities. These discussions are often complex and can take many years to resolve. Accruals for tax contingencies require management to make
	estimates and judgments with respect to the ultimate outcome of a tax audit, and actual results could vary from these estimates. Where tax exposures can be quantified, a provision is made based on best estimates and management&#146;s judgments.
	Given the inherent uncertainties in assessing the outcomes of these exposures (which can sometimes be binary in nature), the Company could, in future years, experience adjustments to this provision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Management believes that the Company&#146;s position on all open matters including those in current discussion with local tax authorities is robust and
	that the Company is appropriately provided.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Following the enactment of the Finance Act 2013, the standard rate of corporation tax in the UK changed
	to 21% with effect from April&nbsp;1 2014 and reduced by a further 1% to 20% from April&nbsp;1 2015.&nbsp;Through the enactment of the Finance Act (No. 2) 2015 the standard rate of corporation tax in the UK will change from 20% to 19% with effect
	from April&nbsp;1, 2017 and by a further 1% to 18% from April&nbsp;1 2020.&nbsp;As the reductions to 19% and 18% were enacted on October&nbsp;26, 2015, these rates are reflected in these financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-30
</P>

<B>
	Leased equipment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Company leases items of machinery in Sweden under finance leases. As at December 31, 2015, the net carrying amount of the leased assets was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.3m (March 31,
	2015:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	F-32

<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Security
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Borrowings have been provided by a syndicate of third party lenders, (the &#147;Syndicate&#148;). The Syndicate together with holders of the bond issue
	have security over the assets of the &#145;guarantor group&#146;. The &#145;guarantor group&#146; consists of those companies which individually have more than 5% of consolidated gross assets or EBITDA of the Company and in total comprise more than
	80% of consolidated gross assets or EBITDA at any testing date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-33
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s goodwill, brand and customer relationships values have been allocated based on the enterprise value
	at acquisition of each cash generating unit (&#147;CGU&#148;). Goodwill is monitored at an operating segment level. As required by IAS 36 &#147;Impairment of Assets&#148;, an annual review of the carrying amount of the goodwill and the indefinite
	life brands is carried out to identify whether there is any impairment to these carrying values. This is done by means of comparison of the carrying values to the value in use of the CGU. Value in use is calculated as the net present value of the
	projected risk-adjusted cash flows of each CGU.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Key assumptions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The values for the key assumptions were arrived at by taking into consideration detailed historical information and comparison to external sources where
	appropriate, such as market rates for discount factors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_42"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Budgeted cash flows:&nbsp;the calculation of value in use has been based on the cash flows forecast in the 2016 budget and applying the same assumptions for future periods in the absence of longer term detailed
	forecasts.&nbsp;These plans have been prepared and approved by management, and incorporate past performance of the entities acquired in the period, historical growth rates and projections of developments in key markets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Sales:&nbsp;projected sales are built up with reference to markets and product platforms.&nbsp;They incorporate past performance, historical growth rates and projections of developments in key markets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Discount rate:&nbsp;a pre-tax discount rate of 7.8% was applied to the cash flows.&nbsp;This discount rate has been calculated using a capital asset pricing model using observable market data, including the share price
	of Nomad Foods Limited.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	Long-term growth rates:&nbsp;as required by IAS 36, growth rates for the period after the detailed forecasts are based on past performance.&nbsp;The growth rate used in the testing was 0.5%.&nbsp;These rates do not
	reflect the long-term assumptions used by the Company for investment planning.
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Sensitivity to changes in assumptions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	No impairment is indicated in 2015 as the recoverable amount calculated based on value in use exceeded carrying value by more than
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	700 million. A reasonably possible change in the following assumptions made by management in assessing the recoverable amount of the CGU would result in the
	carrying amount exceeding its recoverable amount resulting in an impairment to the Company&#146;s goodwill balance:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Discount rate:&nbsp;A rise in pre-tax discount rate to 9.3% from 7.8% would remove the remaining headroom.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Long term growth rate:&nbsp;A reduction in the long-term growth rate by 1.1% to -0.6% would remove the remaining headroom.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	14)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Acquisitions
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Iglo Acquisition
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On June 1, 2015 the Iglo Acquisition was completed for consideration of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,420.8 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the seven months between June 1, 2015
	and December 31, 2015, the Iglo Group contributed total revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	791.5 million and loss before tax of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	18.0 million to the Company&#146;s results. If the acquisition had occurred on January 1, 2015 management estimates that consolidated revenue would have been
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,431.9 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1,500.9 million for the 12 months ended December 31, 2014 as if the acquisition had
	occurred on January 1, 2014) and consolidated loss before tax for the period would have been
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	438.7 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	65.9 million loss). In determining these amounts, management has assumed that the fair value adjustments, determined provisionally, that arose on the date
	of acquisition would have been the same if the acquisition had occurred on January 1, 2015 and January 1, 2014 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The transaction was
	funded through a combination of Nomad&#146;s cash on hand, equity and proceeds from a private placement in April 2015 of approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	729.8 million at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.60 ($10.50) per Ordinary Share (75.7 million Ordinary Shares), proceeds of approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	154.3 million from the early exercise of 48.1 million of Nomad&#146;s existing warrants at reduced price of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.60 ($10.50) per whole Ordinary Share (16.0 million Ordinary Shares), as well as the assumption of approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.2 billion of the Iglo Group&#146;s existing debt. The seller of the Iglo Group re-invested a portion of their proceeds into
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	133.5 million of equity (13.7 million Ordinary Shares) at closing. Each of the Founder Entities (either directly or through an affiliate) subscribed for 1.9
	million Ordinary Shares and exercised all of their outstanding warrants (1.5 million warrants each) in conjunction with the transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Acquisition-related
	costs
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the 9 months ended December 31, 2015, the Company incurred acquisition related costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	25.2 million on legal fees, due diligence costs, and fees in relation to the amendment of the Company&#146;s senior debt (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.7 million).
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	19.7 million of these costs have been included in
	exceptional items (see Note 7). The remainder relates to capitalized debt fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-36

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The goodwill recognized is attributable mainly to the growth prospects for the business expected organically and through
	strategic acquisitions and the assembled workforce.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Contingent liabilities acquired
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Contingent liabilities acquired have been recognized based on management&#146;s assessment of their fair value based on the estimated value and
	likelihood of payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Fair values measured on a provisional basis
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If new information obtained within one year of the date of acquisition about facts and circumstances that existed at the date of acquisition identifies
	adjustments to the above amounts, or any additional provisions that existed at the date of acquisition, then the accounting for the acquisition will be revised.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Findus acquisition
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 2, 2015 the Company completed its acquisition of Findus Sverige
	AB and its subsidiaries (the &#147;Findus Group&#148;) for consideration of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	672.9 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-37
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the two months between November 2, 2015 and December 31, 2015 the Findus Group&#146;s business
	contributed total revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	102.6 million and loss before tax of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.6 million to the Company&#146;s results. If the acquisition had occurred on January 1, 2015 management estimates that consolidated revenue, including
	the Iglo Group, would have been
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2,066.9 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2,134.9 million for the 12 months ended December 31, 2014 as if the acquisition had occurred on January 1, 2014) and consolidated loss before tax for the
	period would have been
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	437.3 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	57.5 million
	loss). In determining these amounts, management has assumed that the fair value adjustments, determined provisionally, that arose on the date of acquisition would have been the same if the acquisition had occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and January
	1, 2014 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The transaction was funded through a combination of Nomad&#146;s cash on hand, equity and proceeds from the issuance of a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million tranche of senior debt under Nomad Foods&#146; credit facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table summarizes the recognized amounts of assets acquired and liabilities assumed at the date of
	acquisition&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(November 2, 2015).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The goodwill recognized is attributable mainly to the expectation of future economic benefit in respect of achievable
	cost synergies and growth potential arising from the combined business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

	Contingent liabilities acquired
</I>

	Contingent liabilities acquired have been recognized based on management&#146;s assessment of their fair value based on the estimated value and
	likelihood of payment.
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If new information obtained within one year of the date of acquisition about facts and circumstances that
	existed at the date of acquisition identifies adjustments to the above amounts, then the accounting for the acquisition will be revised.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Acquisition-related
	costs
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company incurred acquisition related costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	16.9 million on legal fees, due diligence costs, and fees in relation to the amendment of the senior debt.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.5 million of these costs have been included in exceptional items (see Note 7). The remainder relates to capitalized debt fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-39

	month period to December&nbsp;31, 2015.&nbsp;See Note 14 for further information.&nbsp;Iglo Foods Group Limited holds a parent company guarantee covering the liabilities of its non-trading subsidiary, Birds Eye Ipco Ltd.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Deferred income tax assets are recognized for tax loss carry-forwards to the extent that the realization of the related
	tax benefit through future taxable profits is probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Deferred tax assets that the Company has not recognized in the financial statements amount
	to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	67.1 million (March 31, 2015: nil; December 31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	16.4
	million). These deferred tax assets have not been recognized as the likelihood of recovery is not probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The aggregate deferred tax relating to
	items that have been charged directly to equity is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.5 million (March 31, 2015: nil; December 31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.0 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-41
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During the nine months ended December 31, 2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.5 million (March 31, 2015: nil; December&nbsp;31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5.9
	million) was charged to the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss for the write down of inventories. The December&nbsp;31 predecessor charge excludes a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.8 million write down of inventory in 2014 damaged in the Cisterna fire which has been included within exceptional items.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	* Refer to Note 4(a). Reduction in trade term amounts are primarily not past due.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All impaired trade receivables have been provided to the extent that they are believed not to be recoverable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The maximum exposure to credit risk at the reporting date is the fair value of each class of receivable.&nbsp;The Company does not hold any collateral
	as security.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	19)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Indemnification assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As part of the acquisition of the Iglo Group and the Findus Group, the
	Company inherited several contingent liabilities for which the sellers have provided an indemnity.&nbsp;To the extent that the liability has been recognized in the balance sheet, an indemnification asset has been recognized, in total
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	77.8 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-43
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The indemnification asset recognized in relation to the Findus Group is secured by shares held in escrow,
	so that the value of the assets may, in the future, be restricted to the value of these shares as at the balance sheet date. As at the December 31, 2015,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	67.6 million of the indemnification assets relate to the acquisition of the Findus Group for which 7,202,179 shares are held in escrow and are valued at
	$11.80 (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.84) each. Subsequent to December 31, 237,762 shares have been released from escrow following the final settlement of consideration payable,
	reducing the shares held in escrow to 6,964,417.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#145;Cash and cash equivalents&#146; comprise cash balances and call deposits. Bank overdrafts that are repayable on
	demand and form an integral part of the Company&#146;s cash management are included as a component of cash and cash equivalents for the purpose of the Statement of Cash Flows only.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company uses a notional cash pooling system where funds are considered on a net basis and grouped together as cash and cash equivalents.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	21)

	Loans and borrowings

	is as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The interest rate on all other loans and the floating rate senior secured notes are re-priced within one year to the
	relevant Euribor or Libor rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In connection with the Iglo Acquisition, Iglo&#146;s Senior Facilities Agreement (&#147;SFA&#148;) was amended and
	restated effective as of June 1, 2015. Commitments and participations of the lenders that opted not to exchange their existing commitment participations, or were otherwise in excess of agreed allocations for the existing, consenting lenders, which
	totaled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	490 million, were prepaid and cancelled in full at the closing of the Iglo Acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Estimated costs associated with the amendment of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5.4
	million have been capitalized. The adjustment reflects the reduced interest expense in relation to the repayment offset by increased amortization of debt issuance costs which will have a continuing impact on the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 2, 2015 as part of the funding of the Findus Acquisition, the Company incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	325 million of new senior term loan debt under its existing Senior Facilities Agreement.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	285 million of
	which, was used to fund the Findus Acquisition and the remainder of was used for general corporate purposes. The new term loan bears interest at EURIBOR plus a margin ranging from 4.0% per annum to 4.25% per annum, matures on June 30, 2020 and is
	secured by certain subsidiaries&#146; assets and ranks pari passu with the Company&#146;s existing senior secured indebtedness. Eligible transaction costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.4 million have been capitalized as part of the refinancing and are amortized over the life of the debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-45
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition to this the Company has a multicurrency revolving credit facility of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	80.0 million. This facility is available until December 31, 2019. As at December 31, 2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.5 million has been utilized for letters of credit, overdrafts, customer bonds and bank guarantees against the revolving credit facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On July 17, 2014 the Iglo Group completed a
	refinancing of its Senior debt with a syndicate of banks. All Senior debt as at the balance sheet date was repaid and replaced with new Senior Euro debt of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	620 million and Senior GBP debt of &pound;400 million, which are repayable on June 30, 2020. In addition to this,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	500 million was raised through the issuance of a floating rate bond issue on the Luxembourg Stock Exchange, with a repayment date of June 15, 2020. Both
	the new Senior debt and the bond issue are secured with equal ranking against certain assets of the Iglo Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Guarantees and secured assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Syndicate of lenders that finance the Company&#146;s Senior debt, have security over the assets of the &#147;Guarantor Group&#148;. The Guarantor
	Group consists of those companies which individually have more than 5% of consolidated gross assets or Adjusted EBITDA of the Company and in total comprise more than 80% of consolidated gross assets or Adjusted EBITDA at any testing date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In connection with its pension scheme, Findus Sverige AB, a 100% owned subsidiary, is required to obtain credit insurance with PRI Pensionsgaranti
	(&#147;PRI&#148;), a credit insurance company which provides insurance annually against the risk of a sponsoring company&#146;s insolvency. In connection with such credit insurance, as at December 31, 2015 Findus Sverige AB has granted floating
	charges over certain assets in favor of PRI in an amount of SEK 300 million (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	32.6 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Capitalization of transaction costs
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Fees paid on the
	establishment of loan facilities are recognized as transaction costs of the loan to the extent that it is probable that some or all of the facility will be drawn down.&nbsp;In this case, the fee is deferred until the draw-down occurs.&nbsp;To the
	extent there is no evidence that it is probable that some or all of the facility will be drawn down the fee is capitalized as a pre-payment for liquidity services and amortized over the period of the facility to which it relates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-46
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	23)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee benefits
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company operates defined benefit pension plans in Germany, Italy, Sweden
	and Austria, as well as various defined contribution plans in other countries.&nbsp;All of these schemes were inherited from the Predecessor or acquired from the Findus Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Defined contribution plans
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The total expense relating to defined contribution plans for the nine month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.4 million.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil for the year ended March 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The total expense relating to defined
	contribution plans for the five months period ended May&nbsp;31, 2015 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.4&nbsp;million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2014 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	ii)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Defined Benefit plans
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company operates unfunded defined benefit pension plans in Sweden and
	Italy, which was acquired in connection with the Findus Acquisition and in Germany, Italy and Austria, which were acquired in connection with the Iglo Acquisition.&nbsp;The defined benefit pension plans are partially funded in Germany and Austria
	and unfunded in Sweden and Italy.&nbsp;In addition, an unfunded post-retirement medical plan is operated in Austria.&nbsp;In Germany and Italy long term service awards are in operation and various other countries provide other employee benefits.
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-47
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The obligation of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.8
	million (March 31, 2015: nil; December 31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.6 million) in respect of other countries is the aggregate of a large number of different types of minor
	schemes, each one not being considered material. Consequently detailed disclosure of these schemes is not provided.
</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="54%">

	In valuing the liabilities of the pension fund at December 31, 2015, mortality assumptions have been made as indicated
	below.&nbsp;The assumptions relating to longevity underlying the pension liabilities at the financial year end date are based on standard actuarial mortality tables and include an allowance for future improvements in longevity.&nbsp;The assumptions
	are based on the following mortality tables:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Post-employment medical benefits- sensitivity analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The effect of a 1% movement in the assumed medical cost trend rate is not significant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Defined benefit obligation- sensitivity analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The effect
	of a 1% movement in the discount rate is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#128;
</FONT>
	m&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There are no deficit elimination plans for any of the defined benefit schemes. Expected contributions to post-employment
	benefit plans for the period ending December 31, 2016 are
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.8m. The weighted average duration of the defined benefit obligations is 16.1 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There were no defined benefit retirement plans, post-employment medical benefits or other benefits in the year ended March 31, 2015.
</P>

	31.8&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
