<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Management incentive plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The acquisition of Iglo was a triggering event under the management incentive plan of the Iglo Group. The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	51.2&nbsp;million provision on acquisition was paid in June 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Restructuring
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	21.0 million provision relates to committed plans for
	certain operational restructuring activities which are due to be completed within the next 18 months. The amounts have been provided based on information available on the likely expenditure required to complete the committed plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Provisions relating to other taxes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	31.8 million provision relates to other taxes due to tax authorities after tax investigations within certain operating subsidiaries within the Iglo Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Contingent consideration
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The contingent consideration
	provision of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	17.4 million relates to deferred consideration payable for three separate transactions by the Findus Group entities. The largest of these is
	for the La Cocinera acquisition in Spain in April&nbsp;2015 for which a provision of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.1 million is held. The consideration payable is dependent on
	specific future events and performance conditions being met for which the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.1 million represents the discounted present value of the most likely outcome.
	The payment is deferred until April 2020 but must be paid earlier if certain decisions are made by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	7.8 million relates to the payment for the Frudesa brand acquired in Spain in 2011 which is payable in June&nbsp;2016. This payment will be for a maximum of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	8.0 million depending on financial performance. Lastly,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.5&nbsp;million is provided for the payment for the Lutosa brand in Belgium acquired in 2014 which is payable in 2019.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Other
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.7 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.5 million) relates to potential obligations under Italian law for three principal items:
	a legal case involving disputed overtime entitlement, obligations potentially payable to agents of the Company and a provision for the scrapping of freezer cabinets.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.9 million corresponds to charges incurred by the Iglo Group relating to acquisitions from previous accounting periods and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.9 million relates to professional fees in respect of the above mentioned tax investigations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-54
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Restructuring
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	12.5 million provision as at December 31, 2014 relates to committed plans for certain operational restructuring activities. The amounts have been provided
	based on information available on the likely expenditure required to complete the committed plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Other
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.5 million provision related to the Italian operations
	for potential obligations under Italian law for three principal items: a legal case involving disputed overtime entitlement, obligations potentially payable to agents of Iglo and a provision for the scrapping of freezer cabinets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3.9 million provision has been provided for in 2014 in
	relation to tax matters from previous accounting years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	25)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-55
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Ordinary Shares
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	No Ordinary Shares were issued upon incorporation of the Company. On April 11, 2014, together with one warrant, 48.5 million Ordinary Shares were issued
	in the initial public offering prior to the company&#146;s admission to the London Stock Exchange and 25,000 Ordinary Shares were issued to the Company&#146;s Non-Executive Directors, Lord Myners, Alun Cathcart and Guy Yamen.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company issued 121.5 million Ordinary Shares between April 1, 2015 and September&nbsp;30, 2015.&nbsp;Of these, 13.7&nbsp;million were issued as a
	partial non-cash consideration for the acquisition of the Iglo Group on June&nbsp;1, 2015, 75.7&nbsp;million were issued through a private placement on May 26, 2015 and a further 15.4 million were issued through a subsequent private placement on
	July 8, 2015.&nbsp;16.7 million Ordinary Shares were issued from the early exercise of warrants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 2, 2015 Nomad issued 8.4 million
	shares as a partial non-cash consideration for the acquisition of Findus Sverige AB and its subsidiaries.&nbsp;See Note 14 for further information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November 27, 2015, the Company issued a further 13,104 shares to key management employees acquired through a bonus issue scheme.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On January 12, 2016, the Company issued a share dividend of 3.6 million Ordinary Shares (the &#147;Founder Preferred Share Dividend&#148;) pursuant to
	the terms of the outstanding founder preferred shares of the Company (the &#147;Founder Preferred Shares&#148;). See the &#145;Founder Preferred Shares&#146; section of this note below for additional information. Following this issuance, the Company
	had 182,065,410 Ordinary Shares outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Cost of admission
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Cost of admission includes the share issuance expenses on initial public offering, which are disclosed as a deduction directly against the capital
	reserve, are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Total
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	5.3&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Founder Preferred Shares
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Two (2) Founder Preferred Shares were issued upon incorporation to the Founder Entities. On April 15, 2014, in connection with our initial public
	offering, we issued an additional aggregate of 1,499,998 shares of Founder Preferred Shares equally to the Founder Entities for $10.00 per share. Of the total cash received for the Founder Preferred Shares,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.3&nbsp;million was allocated to the liability component arising at the date of issue and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	10.6 million
	allocated to equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Accordingly, Nomad&#146;s issued Founder Preferred Share capital consists of 1,500,000 Founder Preferred Shares. There are no
	Founder Preferred Shares held in Treasury. Founder Preferred Shares confer upon the holder the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the right to one vote per Founder Preferred Share on all matters to be voted on by shareholders generally and vote together with the holders of ordinary shares;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	commencing on January 1, 2015 and for each financial year thereafter:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	once the average price per ordinary share for any ten consecutive trading days is at least $11.50 (which condition has been satisfied), the right to receive a Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount (as more
	fully described below), payable in Ordinary Shares or cash, at the Company&#146;s sole option; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-56
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the right to receive dividends and other distributions as may be declared from time to time by the Company&#146;s board of directors with respect to the Ordinary Shares (such dividends to be distributed among the
	holders of Founder Preferred Shares, as if for such purpose the Founder Preferred Shares had been converted into Ordinary Shares immediately prior to such distribution) plus an amount equal to 20% of the dividend which would be distributable on such
	number of Ordinary Shares equal to the Preferred Share Dividend Equivalent (as defined below);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	in addition to amounts payable pursuant to clause 2 above, the right, together with the holders of Ordinary Shares, to receive such portion of all amounts available for distribution and from time to time distributed by
	way of dividend or otherwise at such time as determined by the Directors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the right to an equal share (with the holders of Ordinary Shares on a share for share basis) in the distribution of the surplus assets of Nomad on its liquidation as are attributable to the Founder Preferred Shares; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the ability to convert into Ordinary Shares on a 1-for-1 basis (mandatorily upon a Change of Control or the seventh full financial year after an acquisition).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount is structured to provide a dividend based on the future appreciation of the market value of the
	Ordinary Shares thus aligning the interests of the Founders with those of the investors on a long term basis.&nbsp;Commencing with 2015, the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount was equal to 20% of the increase in the market price of our
	Ordinary Shares (based upon the volume weighted average Ordinary Share&nbsp;price for the last 10 trading days of the year) compared to the initial public offering price of $10 multiplied by 140,220,619 Ordinary Shares (the (Preferred Share Dividend
	Equivalent&#148;), which was the number of Ordinary Shares outstanding immediately following the Iglo Acquisition but excluding Ordinary Shares issued to the prior shareholders of Iglo pursuant to or in connection with the Iglo Acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For any subsequent financial year in which the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount becomes payable (i.e. if the Dividend Price during such
	subsequent year is greater than the highest Dividend Price in any preceding year in which a dividend was paid in respect of the Founder Preferred Shares), the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount will be 20% of the increase in the
	Dividend Price over the highest prior Dividend Price in any preceding year multiplied by Preferred Share Dividend Equivalent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The amounts used for
	the purposes of calculating the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount and the relevant numbers of Ordinary Shares are subject to such adjustments for share splits, share dividends and certain other recapitalization events as the Directors
	in their absolute discretion determine to be fair and reasonable in the event of a consolidation or sub-division of the Ordinary Shares in issue after the date of admission to trading or otherwise as determined in accordance with Nomad&#146;s
	Memorandum and Articles of Association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Dividends on the Founders Preferred Shares are payable until the Founders Preferred Shares are converted
	into Ordinary Shares.&nbsp;The Founders Preferred Shares automatically convert on a one for one basis (i) on the last day of the seventh full financial year following our acquisition of Iglo Foods (or if such day is not a trading day, the next
	trading day) or (ii) in the event of a change of control (unless the independent directors of our board of directors determine otherwise).&nbsp;The holders of Founders Preferred Shares may also be converted to Ordinary shares on a one for one basis
	at the option of the holder.&nbsp;In the event of an automatic conversion, a dividend on the Founders Preferred Shares shall be payable with respect to the shorted dividend year on the trading day immediately prior to the conversion.&nbsp;In the
	event of an optional conversion by the holder, no dividend on the Founder Preferred Shares shall be payable with respect to the year in which the conversion occurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-57
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On January 12, 2016 the Company&#146;s Board of Directors approved a share dividend to the Founder Entities
	of an aggregate of 3,620,510 Ordinary Shares pursuant to the terms of the outstanding Founder Preferred Shares of the Company. Because the average price per Ordinary Share was at least $11.50 for ten consecutive trading days in 2015, the holders of
	the Founder Preferred Shares were entitled to receive the Founder Preferred Share Annual Dividend Amount. See Note 27 for further information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Warrants
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On April 11, 2014 in conjunction with its initial public offering, Nomad issued an aggregate 50,000,000 Warrants to purchasers of both its
	Ordinary and Founder Preferred Shares.&nbsp;In addition, 75,000 Warrants in aggregate were issued to Non-Executive directors as part of their appointment as directors.&nbsp;Each Warrant entitled its holder to subscribe for one-third of an ordinary
	share upon exercise (subject to any prior adjustment in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in the Warrant Instrument).&nbsp;Warrant holders were required therefore (subject to any prior adjustment) to hold and validly exercise three
	Warrants and pay $11.50 per Ordinary Share in order to receive one Ordinary Share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Warrants were also subject to mandatory redemption at $0.01
	per Warrant if at any time the volume-weighted average price per ordinary share equaled or exceeded $18.00 (subject to any prior adjustment in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in the Warrant Instrument) for a period of ten
	consecutive trading days.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On May 6, 2015 In connection with the Iglo acquisition, the Company obtained the consent of over 75% of the holders of
	outstanding Warrants to an amendment to the terms of the Warrants in order to provide that the subscription period for the Warrants, which previously would have expired on the third anniversary of the Company&#146;s consummation of its first
	acquisition, would instead expire on the consummation of the Iglo Group acquisition (except in certain limited circumstances, in which case, such holder will be permitted to exercise his, her or its Warrants until the date that is 30 days following
	the date of Readmission). The Warrant Amendment was thereby effective on May 6, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of December 31, 2015 all warrants have either been
	exercised or cancelled.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor Share capital and capital reserve
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
	1&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The holders of ordinary shares are entitled to receive dividends as declared from time to time and are entitled to one
	vote per share at meetings of Iglo.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Predecessor capital reserve balance as at December 31, 2014 comprised
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.8 million share premium on Class &#145;I&#146; and &#145;J&#146; shares issued in May 2013. The remaining
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.8 million in Iglo Group related to the Predecessor share based payment charges, see Note 8 for detail.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-58
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	26)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Share-based compensation reserve
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The share-based compensation reserve consists of expenses associated with the issuance of Initial Options in exchange for services during the year or
	period and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.1 million in relation to the Restricted Share Award granted on December 7, 2015 to the Company&#146;s Non-Executive Directors. See Note 8.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Predecessor share-based compensation
	reserve was previously disclosed within capital reserves and has been represented within these financial statements as an additional line item within the Equity/(Deficit) attributable to Parent.&nbsp;See Note 25 for Predecessor.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	27)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Founder Preferred Shares Dividend Reserve
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad has issued Founder Preferred Shares to its
	Founder Entities.&nbsp;A summary of the key terms of the Founder Preferred Shares is set out in Note 25.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	From April 1, 2014 through June 1, 2015
	the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amounts were valued and recognized as a liability under IFRS 2.&nbsp;The fair value of the liability at each balance sheet date was valued using a Monte Carlo simulation and any difference in fair value
	was recorded as an expense As the Founder Preferred Shares were issued to affiliates of certain of the Non-Executive directors of Nomad, the fair value of the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount given to the holders was recorded as an
	expense.&nbsp;There are no further service conditions attached and the expense was recognized immediately.&nbsp;Subsequent to its initial recognition when issued, the liability was adjusted for changes in fair value.&nbsp;Changes in value were
	recorded in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss through June 1, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Key assumption inputs to the valuation of the Founder Preferred
	Shares Annual Dividend Amount are presented below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Risk-free interest rate
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	1.93%&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	1.71%&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The total liability of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	171.3 million at March 31, 2015 included
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	38.2 million
	classified as a current liability based on the fair value of the liability expected to be payable within one year of the balance sheet date at that time. The total charge in the year related to the liability was reduced by the allocation of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.3 million from the total cash received on issue of the Founder Preferred Shares (see Note 24).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Upon completion of the acquisition of the Iglo Group on June 1, 2015, the Company intended that the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount
	would be equity settled. Accordingly, the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount as of June 1, 2015 of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	531.5 million (the &#147;Founder Preferred
	Shares Dividend reserve&#148;) was classified as equity and no further revaluations will be required or recorded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-59
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Assuming the Founder Preferred Shares Dividend reserve of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	531.5 million (which represents the fair value of the Founder Preferred Share Annual Dividend Amount as of June 1, 2015) was settled in Ordinary Shares as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the company would have
	issued 49.0 million additional Ordinary Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	28)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Translation reserve
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The translation reserve comprises all foreign exchange differences arising
	from the translation of the financial statements of foreign operations, as well as from the translation of liabilities that hedge Iglo&#146;s net investment in a foreign subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	29)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Cash flow hedging reserve
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The hedging reserve comprises the effective portion of the cumulative
	net change in the fair value of cash flow hedging instruments related to hedged transactions that have not yet occurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The table below shows the
	movement in the cash flow hedging reserve during the year or period, including the gains or losses arising on the revaluation of hedging instruments during the year or period and the amount reclassified from other comprehensive income to the
	Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss in the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	n/p&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	n/p&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Loss per share (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&#146;s)
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	(2.32)&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	(3.35)&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1.50PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	n/p&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	n/p&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	n/p not presented
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Basic loss is calculated by dividing the loss attributable to shareholders of Nomad by the weighted average number of Ordinary Shares of 144,090,810
	(March 31, 2015:&nbsp;48,525,000) and Founder Preferred Shares of 1,500,000 (March 31, 2015:&nbsp;1,500,000).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Diluted earnings per share equals
	basic earnings per share as the exercise of the Initial Options and Warrants would not be dilutive, given the losses arising.&nbsp;The Ordinary shares that could be issues to settle the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount are potentially
	dilutive.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	31)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Warrant redemption liability
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As a contingent obligation to redeem for cash, a separate liability
	of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.5m (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.01 per Warrant) was recognized at March 31, 2015.
	As at December 31, 2015 all warrants had either been exercised or cancelled.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-60
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	33)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Financial risk management
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Overall risk management policy
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s activities expose it to a variety of
	financial risks, including currency risk, interest rate risk, credit risk and liquidity risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s overall risk
	management program focuses on minimizing potential adverse effects on the Company&#146;s financial performance. The Company uses derivative financial instruments to hedge certain risk exposures.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Risk management is led by senior management and is mainly carried out by a central treasury department which identifies, evaluates and
	hedges financial risks in close cooperation with the Company&#146;s operating units.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Market risk (including currency risk and interest rate risk)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-61
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:9%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In managing market risks, the Company aims to minimize the impact of short term
	fluctuations on the Company&#146;s earnings. Over the longer term, however, permanent changes in foreign exchange rates and interest rates will have an impact on consolidated earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_86"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	&nbsp;Currency risk
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Foreign currency risk on assets and liabilities in currencies other than functional
	currency
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Description
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is exposed to foreign exchange risk arising from the translation of assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the Euro. This affects particularly Nomad&#146;s Pound Sterling loans and overdraft
	balances.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Pound Sterling value of these liabilities is retranslated at closing exchange rates into Euro for inclusion in the financial statements.&nbsp;Fluctuations in the value of these liabilities are caused by variation in the closing
	GBP-EUR exchange rate.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Mitigation &amp; Impact on &nbsp;Statement of Financial &nbsp;Position / Equity / Income &nbsp;Statement
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	100% of the Company&#146;s Pound Sterling loans are designated as hedges against the Company&#146;s investment in its subsidiaries in the UK. As at
	December 31, 2015, this represented 34% of the net assets of the UK businesses (2014: 51%).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The impact of the net investment hedge is taken directly to equity via
	the foreign currency translation reserve. The amount taken to this reserve which arose on the retranslation of the Sterling loans was a gain of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	6.8 million
	(2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	39.5 million). There was no ineffectiveness in the net investment hedge in either 2015, 2014 or 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of the Pound Sterling denominated loans at December 31, 2015 is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	318.9&nbsp;million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	497.0 million) (at closing
	financial year end rates).
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Sensitivity analysis
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	During 2015, the Euro weakened by 6.1% against the Pound Sterling.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	For each 1% that the Euro strengthens or weakens, assuming all other variables remain constant, the impact on the Pound Sterling loans would be a credit or debit to the Company&#146;s equity of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5.6 million, and on the Sterling overdraft balances would be a credit or debit to the Company&#146;s Income Statement of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.6 million.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	In addition, the impact on the related interest charge would be to decrease or increase the charge by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.2 million and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.3 million for each 1% change in the exchange rate in 2015 and 2014 respectively.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	&nbsp;Currency risk
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Foreign currency risk on purchases
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Description
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is exposed to foreign exchange risk where a business unit makes purchases in a currency other than the Euro.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	For the Company, the most significant of these exposures is the purchase of fish inventories in US dollars, the purchase of goods and services in Euros by the UK and the Nordics.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&nbsp;Mitigation &amp; Impact on
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&nbsp;Statement of Financial
	&nbsp;Position / Equity / Income &nbsp;Statement
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s policy is to reduce this risk by using foreign exchange forward contracts which are designated as cash flow hedges.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	These contracts all have a maturity of less than one year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of the US
	dollar forward contracts with reference to non-USD functional currencies as at December 31, 2015 is an asset of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.6 million (2014: 11.1 million). All
	forecast transactions are still expected to occur.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2015, 69%
	(2014:&nbsp;77%) of forecast future dollar payments for the next twelve months were hedged through the use of forward contracts and existing cash.&nbsp;A proportion of the forward contracts have been designated as cash flow hedges.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of the Euro forward contracts with reference to non-Euro functional currencies as at December 31, 2015 is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.2m (2014: liability of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.7 million).
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-62

<TD WIDTH="23%">
</TD>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%">
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	As at December 31, 2015, 58% (2014:&nbsp;63%) of forecast future net euro payments for the next twelve months were hedged through the use of forward contracts and existing cash.&nbsp;A proportion of the forward contracts have been
	designated as cash flow hedges.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">

	&nbsp;Sensitivity&nbsp;analysis
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	During 2015, the Euro weakened by 6.1% against Sterling, and weakened by 10.4% against the US dollar and weakened by 2% against the Swedish Krona.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	On an annualized 2015 basis, for each 1% that the Euro strengthens or weakens against Sterling, assuming all other variables remain constant, the impact relating to these purchases would be to increase or decrease the Company&#146;s
	loss before tax by approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.5 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.7
	million 2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.0 million), excluding the impact of any forward contracts.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	On an annualized 2015 basis, for each 1% that the Euro strengthens or weakens against the US dollar, assuming all other variables remain constant, the impact would be to increase or decrease the Company&#146;s loss before tax by
	approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	2.2 million (2014
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.8 million; 2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1.8 million), excluding the impact of any forward contracts.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	On an annualized 2015 basis, for each 1% that the Euro strengthens or weakens against Swedish Krona, assuming all other variables remain constant, the impact relating to these purchases would be to increase or decrease the
	Company&#146;s loss before tax by approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.5 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.2 million; 2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.3 million), excluding the impact of any
	forward contracts.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	&nbsp;Interest rate risk
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Description
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company has significant levels of floating rate borrowings and is therefore exposed to the impact of interest rate fluctuations.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="13">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&nbsp;Mitigation &amp; Impact on
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&nbsp;Equity&nbsp;/&nbsp;Income&nbsp;Statement
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company&#146;s policy on interest rate risk is designed to limit the Company&#146;s exposure to fluctuating interest rates. The Company designates interest rate caps which limit the maximum interest rate, as cash flow
	hedges.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Interest rate caps hedge 157% (2015: 125%; 2014: 95%) of the Company&#146;s Sterling debt during 2016 and 66% (2015: 74%; 2014: 71%) of the Company&#146;s Euro debt during 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="13">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The interest expense in the Income Statement is shown including the effect of the interest rate caps.&nbsp;It is intended to hold these instruments until maturity so that although the fair value of the instruments will fluctuate
	over the course of their life due to changes in market rates, the instruments will have nil value on expiry.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	During 2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil) was taken to
	equity relating to the change in fair value of these instruments and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil; 2013:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.8 million) was recycled to the Income
	Statement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="13">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Sensitivity analysis
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	In 2015, LIBOR rates were consistent with 2014 and 2013, EURIBOR rates decreased by 0.4 percentage points.&nbsp;Negative interest rates are treated as 0% for the purpose of the interest applied on the senior loans, however for the
	Bond the coupon is reduced if interest rates are negative.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	If interest rates were greater than 1%,
<B>
</B>
	it is estimated that on an annualized 2015 basis, an increase or decrease of one percentage point in the interest rate charge on borrowings would correspondingly decrease or increase
	the Company&#146;s loss before tax by approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	14.5 million (2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	16.3 million).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-63
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Credit risk
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_88"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Description
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Credit risk arises on cash and cash equivalents and derivative financial instruments with banks and financial institutions, as well as on credit exposures to customers.&nbsp;See Note 18 for analysis of the trade receivables balance
	and Note 20 for analysis of the cash and cash equivalents balance.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Mitigation
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company limits counterparty exposures by monitoring each counterparty carefully and where possible, setting credit limits by reference to published ratings.&nbsp;The Company limits its exposure to individual financial
	institutions by spreading forward foreign exchange contracts and surplus cash deposits between several institutions.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The credit quality of customers is assessed taking into account their financial position, past experience and other factors. Credit limits are set for customers and regularly monitored. The Company aims to ensure that the maximum
	exposure to one financial institution does not exceed
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	75.0 million and that the long term credit rating does not fall below Low Double A.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Liquidity risk
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_89"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Description
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is exposed to the risk that it is unable to meet its commitments as they fall due.&nbsp;The Company has financial conditions imposed by its lenders which it must achieve in order to maintain its current level of
	borrowings.&nbsp;A single net debt covenant is carried out quarterly and at the end of each financial year.&nbsp;There have been no breaches of the covenants throughout the year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="10">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="10" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;Mitigation
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company ensures that it has sufficient cash and available funding through regular cash flow and covenant forecasting. In addition, the Company has access to a revolving credit facility of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	80m, expiring in December 2019. This is available to finance working capital requirements and for general corporate purposes. Currently
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.5 million is utilized for letters of credit, overdrafts, customer bonds and bank guarantees.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Capital risk management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nomad&#146;s objectives when managing capital (currently consisting of share capital and share premium) are to safeguard Nomad&#146;s ability to
	continue as a going concern in order to provide returns for shareholders and benefits for other stakeholders and to maintain an optimal capital structure to reduce the cost of capital.&nbsp;In order to maintain or adjust the capital structure, Nomad
	may adjust the amount of dividends paid to shareholders, return capital to shareholders or issue new shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-64
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents

	The tables below show a maturity analysis of contractual undiscounted cash flows, showing items at the earliest date on which the Company could be
	required to pay the liability:

<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;

	The following table shows the carrying amount of
	each Statement of Financial Position class split into the relevant category of financial instrument as defined in IAS 39 &#147;Financial Instruments: Recognition &amp; Measurement&#148;.

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Trade receivables are the only financial assets that are offset on the Statement of Financial Position.&nbsp;See
	Note&nbsp;18 for split between gross receivables and trade terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Fair values
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer
	a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.&nbsp;In determining fair value, Nomad uses various methods including market, income and cost approaches.&nbsp;Based on these approaches, Nomad utilizes
	certain assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability, including assumptions about risk and the risks inherent in the inputs to the valuation technique.&nbsp;These inputs may be readily observable, market
	corroborated, or generally unobservable inputs.&nbsp;Nomad utilizes valuation techniques that maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs.&nbsp;Based on the observability of the inputs used in the valuation
	techniques Nomad is required to provide the following information according to the fair value hierarchy.&nbsp;The fair value hierarchy ranks the quality and reliability of the information used to determine fair values.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Financial assets and liabilities carried at fair value will be classified and disclosed in one of the following three categories:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Level 1&#151;Quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities traded in active exchange markets, such as the New York Stock Exchange.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Level 2&#151;Observable inputs other than Level 1 including quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in less active markets, or
	other observable inputs that can be corroborated by observable market data.&nbsp;Level 2 also includes derivative contracts whose value is determined using a pricing model with observable market inputs or can be derived principally from or
	corroborated by observable market data.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Level 3&#151;Unobservable inputs supported by little or no market activity for financial instruments whose
	value is determined using pricing models, discounted cash flow methodologies, or similar techniques, as well as instruments for which the determination of fair value requires significant management judgment or estimation; also includes observable
	inputs for nonbinding single dealer quotes not corroborated by observable market data.&nbsp;Where market information is not available to support internal valuations, reviews of third party valuations are performed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	While Nomad believes its valuation methods are appropriate and consistent with other market participants, the use of different methodologies or
	assumptions to determine the fair value of certain financial instruments could result in a different estimate of fair value at the reporting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-66
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following is a description of the valuation methodologies and assumptions used for estimating the fair
	values of financial instruments held by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Derivative financial instruments
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Derivative financial instruments are held at fair
	value.&nbsp;There is no difference between carrying value and fair value.&nbsp;The financial instruments are not traded in an active market and so the fair value of these instruments is determined from the implied forward rate.&nbsp;The valuation
	technique utilized by the Company maximizes the use of observable market data where it is available.&nbsp;All significant inputs required to fair value the instrument are observable.&nbsp;The Company has classified its derivative financial
	instruments as level 2 instruments as defined in IFRS 13 &#145;Fair value measurement&#146;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Foreign exchange forward contracts in place which have
	been de-designated under hedge accounting, the fair value gains on those contracts amounted to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.1 million (2014: nil).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(ii)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Trade and other payables/receivables
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The notional amount of trade and other payables/receivables
	are deemed to be carried at fair value, short term and settled in cash.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(iii)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Cash and cash equivalents/overdrafts
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The carrying value of cash is deemed to equal fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(iv)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Interest bearing loans and liabilities
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of senior loans and senior secured notes
	is determined by reference to price quotations in the active market in which they are traded.&nbsp;They are classified as level 2 instruments.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_93"></A>

</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	500.0&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:22PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(v)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Prior to the Iglo acquisition, the Company
	utilized a Monte Carlo simulation to derive the estimated fair value of the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount.&nbsp;Key inputs into the model include probability of an acquisition, market value of Ordinary Shares, expected volatility,
	and a risk-free interest rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-67
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Upon completion of the acquisition of the Iglo Group, the Company intended that the Founder Preferred
	Shares Annual Dividend Amount would be equity settled.&nbsp;Accordingly, the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount as of June 1, 2015 of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	531.5
	million (the &#147;Founder Preferred Shares Dividend reserve&#148;) was classified as equity and no further revaluations will be required or recorded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table presents the Company&#146;s fair value measurement of the Founder Preferred Shares Annual Dividend Amount using significant
	unobservable inputs (Level 3):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Closing balance at December 31, 2015

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Derivatives
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The notional principal amounts of the outstanding forward foreign exchange contracts
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015 were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	224.7 million (December 31, 2014:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	173.1 million).&nbsp;The following table presents the fair value of derivatives as at December 31, 2015.&nbsp;70.1% of the notional principal amount
	relates to USD forward foreign exchange contracts and 20.4% of the notional principal amounts relates to EUR forward foreign exchange contracts for the UK and Nordic subsidiaries.
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Offsetting of derivatives
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Derivative contracts are held under International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) agreements with financial institutions.&nbsp;An ISDA is an
	enforceable master netting agreement that permits the Company to settle net in the event of default.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table sets out the carrying
	amounts of recognized financial instruments that are subject to the above agreements.
</P>
<EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<A NAME="FIS_BALANCE_SHEET"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</B>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Operating leases
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company leases certain buildings, plant and equipment under operating
	leases.&nbsp;The agreements do not share common characteristics across the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Non-cancellable operating lease rentals relate to total future
	aggregate minimum lease payments and are payable as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
