<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Non-cancellable operating leases relate to equipment, motor vehicles and land and buildings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-69
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Findus Sverige AB has a 25 year lease agreement with a third party for a factory and cold-store. For the
	first 10 years of this agreement, 74.3% of the annual lease charge is recovered by a third party sub-let. Included within Cost of Sales is operating lease income of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	0.7 million in relation to this.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	36)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Capital commitments
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company has capital commitments amounting to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	4.9million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 (March&nbsp;31, 2015:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil;
	December 31, 2014: Iglo Group
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5.1 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	37)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Contingent liabilities
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Iglo Group is currently in discussions with the tax authorities in
	one of its markets regarding the treatment of the acquisition of the Iglo Group in 2006 by the previous owners. The Company has an indemnity in respect of this tax issue. A related tax indemnification asset of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil has been recognized as at December&nbsp;31, 2015 (March 31, 2015:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	nil).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	38)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Related parties
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Successor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Promissory Notes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In conjunction with the formation of the
	Company, in consideration for each of the Founder Entities advancing us $100,000, we issued an unsecured promissory note for a principal amount of $100,000 to each of the Founder Entities. The loans did not bear interest and were re-paid in full on
	May&nbsp;14, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Founder Preferred Shares
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each of
	the Founder Entities holds 750,000 shares of Founder Preferred Shares issued at $10.00 per share. The Founder Preferred Shares were intended to incentivize the Founders to achieve Nomad&#146;s objectives. In addition to providing long term capital,
	the Founder Preferred Shares are structured to provide a dividend based on the future appreciation of the market value of the ordinary shares thus aligning the interests of the Founders with those of the holders of ordinary shares on a long term
	basis. The Founder Preferred Shares are also intended to encourage the Founders to grow Nomad following the Iglo Acquisition and to maximize value for holders of ordinary shares. On January&nbsp;12, 2016, we approved a 2015 Founder Preferred Share
	Dividend with respect to 2015 in an aggregate of 3,620,510 ordinary shares payable to the Founder Entities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Advisory Services Agreements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On June 15, 2015, the Company entered into an Advisory Services Agreement with Mariposa Capital, LLC, an affiliate of Mr. Franklin, and TOMS Capital
	LLC, an affiliate of Mr. Gottesman. Pursuant to the terms of the Advisory Services Agreement, Mariposa Capital, LLC and TOMS Capital LLC provide high-level strategic advice and guidance to the Company. Under the terms of the Advisory Services
	Agreement, Mariposa Capital, LLC and TOMS Capital LLC are entitled to receive an aggregate annual fee equal to $2.0 million, payable in quarterly installments. This agreement will expire on June&nbsp;1, 2016 and will be automatically renewed for
	successive one-year terms unless any party notifies the other parties in writing of its intention not to renew the agreement no later than 90 days prior to the expiration of the term. The agreement may only be terminated by the Company upon a vote
	of a majority of its directors.&nbsp;In the event that the agreement is terminated by the Company, the effective date of the termination will be six months following the expiration of the initial term or a renewal term, as the case may be.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Expenses of $495,724 and $554,954 for certain travel costs of Mariposa Capital, LLC and TOMS Capital LLC respectively in the nine months to December 31,
	2015 were reimbursed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-70
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage158"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Private Placement and Warrant Exercises
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In May 2015, each of our Founder Entities (or affiliates thereof) and CEO St&eacute;fan Descheemaeker, our Chief Executive Officer, purchased ordinary
	shares in the May&nbsp;2015 Offering. Mariposa Acquisition II, LLC purchased 1,880,953 of our ordinary shares, TOMS Capital Investments LLC purchased 1,880,953 of our ordinary shares and St&eacute;fan Descheemaeker purchased 2,380,953 of our
	ordinary shares, in each case at a purchase price of $10.50 per share (the same price paid by unaffiliated investors). In connection with the May 2015 Offering, we issued 500,000 ordinary shares to each of the Founder Entities upon exercise of the
	Warrants issued to them in the 2014 Offering at an exercise price of $10.00 per ordinary share issued.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Directors&#146; and Key Management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All significant management decision making authority is vested within the Board of Directors and the executive team, therefore key management are
	considered to be the Directors and executive Officers. Their remuneration has been disclosed in Note&nbsp;9.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As part of the sale of the Iglo Group
	to Nomad Foods Limited, executive officers Paul Kenyon and Tania Howarth acquired shares in Nomad Foods Limited from Birds Eye Iglo Group LP Inc. Paul Kenyon acquired 37,060 shares and Tania Howarth acquired 38,956 shares at a price of $10.50 (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	9.71) per share which was deemed to be at fair value.&nbsp;A proportion of these shares are restricted and may not be sold until conditions relating to the sale
	have been met.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nation of 6 Limited, a company which is beneficially owned by Mr. Leoni Sceti (a prior non-executive director and predecessor
	executive officer) and his family, holds an indirect interest of 205,812 ordinary shares in Nomad Foods Limited.&nbsp;Alun Cathcart (a prior non-executive director) holds 47,500 ordinary shares in Nomad Foods Limited which includes 37,500 ordinary
	shares granted pursuant to a five-year option that expires on June&nbsp;2, 2020 at a purchase price of $11.50 per share.&nbsp;Lord Myners of Truro CBE, a non-executive director, holds 63,333 ordinary shares in Nomad Foods Limited which includes
	50,000 ordinary shares granted pursuant to a five-year option that expires on June&nbsp;2, 2020 at a purchase price of $11.50 per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Certain of
	the Non-Executive Directors are eligible to an annual restricted stock grant issued under the LTIP equal to 8,695 ordinary shares valued at the date of grant, which vest on the earlier of the date of the following year&#146;s annual meeting of
	shareholders or 13 months from the issuance date. An expense of $60,606 has been recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or loss in the nine months to December&nbsp;31, 2015. See Note&nbsp;39 &#147;Significant events after the Statement
	of Financial Position date&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Predecessor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Birds Eye Iglo
	Limited Partnership Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Iglo Group was previously controlled by the Permira Partnership, who owned 100% of Iglo&#146;s share capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2006, Iglo Foods Holdco Limited, a subsidiary of Iglo, issued 17% fixed rate subordinated unsecured Class&nbsp;A, B and C Loan Notes of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1 each to the Permira Partnership in connection with the original acquisition by the Permira Partnership. From January&nbsp;1, 2013 the interest rate on these
	shareholder loan notes were reduced to 11%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2010, as part of the funding for the acquisition of CSI, Iglo Foods Holdco Limited issued 15% fixed
	rate subordinated unsecured
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	167.4m of Class G Loan Notes of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1
	each to the Permira Partnership. From January&nbsp;1, 2013 the interest rate on these shareholder loan notes were reduced to 11%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-71
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During 2013, Iglo Foods Holdco Limited, a subsidiary of Iglo, issued 11% fixed rate subordinated unsecured
	Class&nbsp;K Loan Notes of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1 each to the Permira Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The amounts outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2014 on these loan notes including capitalized interest are disclosed in Note&nbsp;21.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Permira Funds
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Predecessor Iglo Group was backed by a
	private equity fund managed by Permira Advisers LLC. A Shareholder Agreement was entered into on November 3, 2006 whereby Iglo Foods Holdings Limited or one of its subsidiaries was obliged to pay an annual monitoring fee of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#128;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	1 million. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013 and 2012, the entity designated to receive the annual monitoring fee was Permira Advisers LLP.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Directors&#146; and Key Management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All significant
	management decision making authority was vested solely with individuals whom were also Directors of Iglo. Therefore key management was deemed to be only the Directors of Iglo. Their remuneration has been disclosed in Note&nbsp;9.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Cheryl Potter of Permira Advisers LLP held indirect economic interests in the loan notes and the equity of the Company through the Permira Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All Directors of Iglo, with the exception of Cheryl Potter and Tara Alhadeff, held equity interests in the Permira Partnership during 2014 and as
	at December&nbsp;31, 2014 either directly or through a trust structure.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During the year to December 31, 2014 and as at December&nbsp;31, 2014
	Erhard Schoewel and Daniel Pagnoni held interests in the loan notes held by the Permira Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Loan notes to related parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following transactions occurred through the Permira Partnership, between the Iglo Group and related parties, in relation to loan notes. All loan
	notes were acquired by the Company on 1&nbsp;June 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	39)
</B>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Significant events after the Statement of Financial Position date
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Amendment to Memorandum and Articles of
	Association
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On January 12, 2016 the Board of Directors of Nomad Foods Limited approved the amendment and restatement of its memorandum and
	articles of association (&#147;Amended and Restated M&amp;A&#148;) to incorporate certain changes that are technical in nature relating to the Company moving its principal listing of its ordinary shares from the London Stock Exchange to the New York
	Stock Exchange.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-72
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage160"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Founder Preferred Share Dividend
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On January 12, 2016 the Company&#146;s Board of Directors approved a share dividend (the &#147;Founder Preferred Share Dividend&#148;) of an aggregate
	of 3,620,510 Ordinary Shares pursuant to the terms of the outstanding founder preferred shares of the Company (the &#147;Founder Preferred Shares&#148;). As previously disclosed in Note 25, because the average price per Ordinary Share was at least
	$11.50 for ten consecutive trading days in 2015, the holders of the Founder Preferred Shares are entitled to receive the Founder Preferred Share Annual Dividend Amount (as defined in our Amended and Restated M&amp;A), payable in ordinary shares or
	cash, at the Company&#146;s sole option which the Company has elected to settle in Ordinary Shares. The dividend price (&#147;Dividend Price&#148;) used to calculate the Founder Preferred Share Annual Dividend Amount was $11.4824 (calculated based
	upon the volume weighted average price for the last ten trading days of 2015) and the Ordinary Shares underlying the Founder Preferred Share Dividend were issued on January&nbsp;12, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In subsequent years, the Annual Dividend Amount will be calculated based on the appreciated share price compared to the Dividend Price(s) previously
	used in calculating the Founder Preferred Share Dividend. Following the issuance of the Ordinary Shares underlying the Founder Preferred Share Dividend, the Company had 182,065,410 Ordinary Shares outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	United Kingdom Tax Residence
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Effective on and from January
	12, 2016 the Company&#146;s central management and control will be conducted in the United Kingdom and is also the date the Company became resident in the United Kingdom for United Kingdom tax purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Nomad Foods 2015 Long Term Incentive Plan (&#147;LTIP&#148;)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s new LTIP is discretionary and enables the Company&#146;s Compensation Committee to make grants (&#147;Awards&#148;) in the form of
	rights over ordinary shares, to any Director or employee of the Company, although the current intention of the Committee is that Awards be granted only to Directors and senior management. The first Award under this Scheme was granted on
	January&nbsp;1, 2016 as set.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Certain of the Non-Executive Directors are eligible to an annual restricted stock grant issued under the LTIP equal to
	8,695 ordinary shares valued at the date of grant, which vest on the earlier of the date of the following year&#146;s annual meeting of shareholders or 13 months from the issuance date. On December&nbsp;7, 2015 the Company&#146;s Compensation
	Committee granted an award to each Non-Executive Director, with the expense of $60,606 recognized in the Consolidated Statement of Profit or Loss and a corresponding credit to equity over the vesting period to the annual meeting date of shareholders
	to be held in June 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of the grant of the options initially issued on April&nbsp;11, 2014 to the Company&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Executive
</FONT>
	Directors, Lord Myners, Alun Cathcart and Guy Yamen, (as more fully described in Note 25) (the &#147;Initial Options&#148;) is recognized as an expense. The total amount to be expensed is determined by
	reference to the fair value of the awards granted:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Including any market performance condition;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Excluding the impact of any service and non-market performance vesting conditions; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#045;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Including the impact of any non-vesting conditions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The vesting of Awards will be subject to conditions
	determined by the Committee. The current policy of the Committee is for vesting to be both time-based and related to the financial performance of the Company.&nbsp;Generally, the vesting period (i.e. the period over which performance is to be
	measured) will be between three and five years and the ordinary shares subject to the Award will vest subject to the participant remaining an employee of the Company at the vesting date and any performance targets relating to the Award having been
	fulfilled.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-73
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D171646D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Appointment and Resignation of Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Effective February 16, 2016 Victoria Parry and Jeremy Isaacs were appointed to the Board of Directors of the Company and Alun Cathcart and Elio Leoni
	Sceti resigned as Directors of the Company.&nbsp;Mr. Isaacs will serve as Chair of the Compensation Committee and as a member of the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Potential
	closure of Bjuv Factory in Sweden
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On March 31, 2016, Nomad Foods Limited announced the decision to request negotiations with the relevant trade
	unions about a potential closure of the Company&#146;s Bjuv factory and pea processing operations by the end of 2016. The factory produces a range of vegetable and meal products for the retail and food service markets in Sweden, Denmark and Finland
	and production will move to the Company&#146;s Reken and Bremerhaven factories in Germany. The consolidation of operations is expected to create a more efficient supply chain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-74
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage162"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Rule 13a-14(a)/15d-14(a) Certification of Chief Financial Officer
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<EFX_EXHIBIT_4>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_4"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 4.9
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	STATEMENT OF TERMS &amp; CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	This statement gives details of your terms and conditions of employment as specified in the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Employment Rights Act 1996.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	Parties
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1TO6.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	This agreement is between Birds Eye Limited and Tania Howarth. This statement gives details of your employment with the
	above named employer and is correct as at 05 January 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Commencement Date
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Your employment within the role will begin
	on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. Your continuity of employment with Birds Eye Limited will commence from this date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Job Title
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You will be employed as Chief Information Officer or in such capacity as the Company
	may reasonably require.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Location
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You will initially be based at Walton Court, Station Avenue, Walton-on-Thames, KT12
	1NT. You may be required to travel to other associated offices from time to time or may be required to relocate to another location within a reasonable commuting time/distance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Remuneration
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Salary
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Your rate of pay will be &pound;165,000 per annum. Salaries are paid on or around the 21st of each month. Payment is made by bank transfer to your bank
	or building society account. You must have a bank account to which your salary can be transferred automatically. Although the Company will do its best to ensure that your salary is paid on time it will not be responsible if it is paid late because
	of postal delays or bank transfer delays.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Salary shall be reviewed on the 1st April each year, unless otherwise notified to you in writing. There
	is no contractual entitlement to any increase but you will be notified in any case where there is a change to your salary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company will be
	entitled to deduct from your salary or other monies due to you from the Company all sums owed by you to the Company. Details of any deductions will be advised to you in writing in advance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Group Performance Bonus Plan
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The company
	operates a discretionary performance related bonus scheme. The details of which will be notified to employees annually.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:20PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Hours of Work
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There are no set hours of work although normal working office hours are 8.45 am to
	5.00 pm, Monday to Friday with an unpaid lunch. It is anticipated that you will work a minimum of 37.5 hours a week and any additional hours that may reasonably be required of you. Flexi-time is worked in some departments. If applicable, details are
	available from your own department. The Company will require a certain amount of flexibility in your start and finish time and your lunch breaks. The Company reserves the right to alter or vary your working hours to take account of the needs of the
	business. Subject to the term relating to outside employment, under the Working Time Regulations, 1998 you will be required to keep the Company informed of hours to be worked for other employers and the Company reserves the right to vary the number
	of hours worked by you in order to avoid breach of the Working Time Regulations 1998.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You will not be entitled to overtime payment for any hours
	worked in excess of your normal hours of work and you shall have no claim whatsoever against the Company or any of its Associated Companies, for any hours worked in excess of your normal hours of work, unless payment has been expressly agreed in
	writing prior to such hours being worked.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage166"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Holidays
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
<U>
	Holiday year
</U>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1TO6.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;The Company&#146;s holiday year is 1 January to 31 December.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Holiday entitlement
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You will be entitled to 25 days holiday per year plus all public holidays applicable in your normal place of work.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Accrual
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Holiday entitlement will accrue at
	the rate of 2 days (3 in December) per each complete calendar month of employment in a holiday year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Entitlement on termination
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If your employment is terminated and the holiday you have taken exceeds your accrued entitlement, you will pay the Company for the number of days or part
	days difference. The Company reserves the right to deduct any money due in respect of excess holidays from salary or any final payment due to you.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If your employment is terminated and you have taken less than your holiday entitlement, the Company will pay you for the number of days or part days
	difference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Regulations for taking holidays
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All holidays must be agreed in advance by your line manager. Authorisation for the timing or length of these holidays may be refused if the timing is not convenient to the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Up to 5 days holiday a year may be nominated as holiday by the Company, for example, for office closures between Christmas and New Year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	It is in your own interests to plan and take your holidays each year. You will not be able to carry forward holiday from one holiday year to the next without the express consent of your line manager; even with this
	permission this is limited to 5 days. Except upon termination of your employment, no payment will be made for holidays which have been accrued but not taken.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Car/Car Allowance
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Under this Contract and whilst you are legally entitled to drive, the Company
	will provide you with a motor car in accordance&nbsp;with the Company&#146;s car policy as amended from time to time. You will take good care of the motor car and ensure that the provisions and conditions of any policy of insurance relating to it
	are observed in all respects and will at all times conform with all regulations which may from time to time be imposed by the Company in regard to motor cars provided by the Company for use by its employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Your car must be returned to the Company immediately upon termination of your employment (howsoever this arises) in a clean and proper condition,
	together with its keys and all the documents relating to it. The Company reserves the right to deduct any sums from final salary or monies due to you to reflect the condition of the car or the need for any repairs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As an alternative to a Company funded car, you are entitled to a Company car/car allowance at the rate of &pound;900 per month, in accordance with the
	Company&#146;s car policy as amended from time to time. Full details of the Company car policy, procedure and rules are available from the HR Department.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If you are disqualified from driving by a Court or as a result of disability you must immediately inform your manager in writing. If you are
	disqualified, for whatever reason, you may no longer be able to carry out your duties. The Company will consider the possibility of alternative work, however, if this is not reasonably practicable, the Company reserves the right to terminate your
	employment. If your employment continues the Company reserves the right to withdraw your car without compensation.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1TO6.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Sickness Absence
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Details of the Company&#146;s Sickness and Industrial Injuries
	Benefit Scheme (SIIBS) are available on the HR intranet site. Payment for sickness absence is at the Company&#146;s discretion and may be withdrawn at any time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company will be entitled, at its expense, to require you to be examined by a medical practitioner of the Company&#146;s choice at
	any time and you agree that the doctor carrying out the examination may disclose to and discuss with the Company the results of the examination.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:14PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Pension
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You will be entitled to participate in the new company DC pension arrangements. These are
	being finalised currently and will be shared with all employees in due course.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:14PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Termination of Employment
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company may terminate your employment without notice and without
	pay in lieu of notice in the event of gross misconduct (a non-exhaustive list of examples of gross misconduct can be found in the Disciplinary Policy available from the Human Resources Department).&nbsp;Subject to this right to terminate your
	employment without notice, you are entitled to receive 3 calendar months notice of termination of employment. You will continue to receive the salary and benefits you are entitled to under this Contract during this period. You are required to
<I>
	give
</I>
	3 calendar months&#146; written notice of termination of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On either party serving notice to terminate your employment for
	any reason or at any time thereafter during the currency of such notice, the Company may, if it chooses, pay to you a salary in lieu of the notice or the unexpired portion of the notice period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At any time during your notice period, the Company may ask you only to perform specific duties or no duties at all and may ask you to take garden leave
	and not to attend work during all or any part of your notice period. In addition the Company may instruct you not to contact or communicate with suppliers, customers, clients, investors, employees, agents, trustees or representatives of the Company
	except as specifically authorised or instructed by the Company. You agree to comply with any such requests. All other obligations and the payment of salary and provision of benefits in accordance with your employment will be unaffected except that
	any holiday entitlement that accrues during any such period of leave will be deemed to have been taken during the period of leave.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If you apply for
	or are offered a new employment, appointment or engagement, before accepting any position you will bring the terms of this Contract relating to confidentiality and post termination restrictions to the attention of the third party proposing directly
	or indirectly to employ, appoint or engage you.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<U>
	Return of Property
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On request and in any event on the termination of your employment, you must immediately return to the Company, or its authorised representative any
	Company property which may be in your possession or under your control. This includes but is not limited to, all documents in whatever form, electronic or otherwise, (including tapes and computer discs, notes, papers, minutes of meetings, records,
	customer lists, computer print outs, plans, projections) received or made by you relating to the business of the Company (without taking copies or extracts or summaries), Company car, any credit or charge cards, passes, computer hard and/or
	software, mobile phone, fax or keys.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The ownership of all such property and documents will at all times remain vested in the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Private Health Care
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You (and your immediate family members if you wish) will be eligible for
	private health cover under the Company&#146;s private health care scheme. This benefit will be subject to an amount accountable for tax as agreed with the Inland Revenue and all tax liability will be borne by you.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Codes of Conduct, Disciplinary &amp; Grievance Procedures
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Details of these codes and procedures
	are available in the employee handbook and from the HR Department. If you are dissatisfied with any disciplinary decision relating to you, you may appeal in writing in accordance with the disciplinary procedure to your manager&#146;s manager. If you
	wish to pursue a grievance you should submit the grievance in writing in accordance with the procedure also to your manager&#146;s manager.&nbsp;The grievance procedure is not to be used to challenge a disciplinary decision.&nbsp;The disciplinary
	and grievance procedures do not form part of this Contract and the Company reserves the right to amend them at any time.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage168"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1TO6.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	However, the Company reserves the right to suspend you with or without full pay pending the outcome of
	any investigations and subsequent disciplinary hearings or as a disciplinary penalty.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You shall comply with all Company and site rules, policies
	and procedures contained within policy documents, site manuals, rules and procedures documents and conditions of employment published from time to time. Copies of these rules, policies and procedures can be obtained from the Human Resources
	Department&nbsp;and include, without limitation, health, safety and hygiene rules and equal opportunities and harassment policies. For the avoidance of doubt such rules, policies and procedures can be changed, replaced or withdrawn at any time at
	the discretion of the Company. Breach of any Company rules, policies or procedures may result in disciplinary action.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	15.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Confidential Information
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	In the course of your employment with the Company, you will have access to and will be entrusted with information in respect of the business, affairs and
	financing of the Company, its suppliers, agents, distributors or customers, including but not limited to information relating to trade secrets or secret information,&nbsp;research, technical know-how, methods, processes, products, designs, pricing,
	marketing, business and financial plans, acquisition plans, clients and customers, stored or kept in any format, all of which information is confidential and belongs to the Company.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You shall not (except in the proper course of his/her duties) at any time during the course of employment or any time thereafter, without the Company&#146;s
	prior written consent, use or disclose to any person directly or indirectly any Confidential Information for any reason other than for the proper conduct of the Company&#146;s business whilst in the course of your employment, except as required by
	law or in any judicial or administrative hearing, provided that the President gives notice and assists in resisting if the company chooses to do so.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	All Confidential Information, software, diskettes, intellectual property including but not limited to copy-rightable material&nbsp;and/or documents, books,
	notes, tapes, instruments and property of any kind (either tangible or intangible) that you have received or made during employment with the Company are the property of the Company and you shall return such property to the Company upon termination
	of employment for whatever reason or shall be so surrendered at the request of the Company during the course of employment.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	You shall not during the continuance of employment, and for any period following termination of such employment as is specified upon such termination, publish or cause to be published any opinion, fact or material
	relating to or connected with the business of the Company or its clients (whether confidential or not) without first obtaining the consent of the Company to the extent such publication might reasonably be expected to have a material and an adverse
	effect on the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	16.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Information &amp; Communications Technology
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:12%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	E-mail, internet and computer policies
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	You must comply with the Company&#146;s policies (if any) on use of e-mail, the internet, intranet and computers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Unauthorised use or tampering with computers will be regarded as gross misconduct and may lead to your summary dismissal. In particular, you may only
	use passwords which you have been authorised to use and must not in any circumstances load a program or data into one of the Company&#146;s computers unless the program and data, originate within the Company, has been provided for your use and has
	been tested for viruses in advance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:12%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
	Confidentiality and monitoring of communications
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company provides telephones (including mobile and voice-mail), e-mail and internet access for business purposes. Although the Company permits
	reasonable use of these facilities for personal use, you are notified that communications made and received by you are not confidential.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the
	purposes of business (including but not limited to quality control, monitoring of policy compliance and unauthorised use and checking messages during periods of absence), communications made by or to employees may be monitored or recorded. This
	applies in particular to telephone (including mobile and voice-mail), e-mail and internet use.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P1TO6.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	17.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Health &amp; Safety
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In accordance with health and safety legislation you must:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	while at work take reasonable care for the health and safety of yourself and others who may be affected by what you do or do not do at work;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	co-operate with the Company so that it can ensure in so far as is reasonably practicable the health, safety and welfare at work of all its employees;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	comply with any duties or requirements relating to health and safety;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	comply with any rules or regulations made from time to time by the Company for the health, safety and welfare of its employees; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	you must not interfere with or misuse anything provided by the Company in the interests of health, safety and welfare.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	18.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Outside Employment
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During your employment with the Company you must not, except with written
	prior permission, be personally employed or engaged in any capacity with any business other than the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	19.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee&#146;s Covenants
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You shall not in the course of employment work for, or be engaged by, or otherwise be involved in, any company, firm or organisation whose business is
	similar to or in competition with the business of the Company.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You shall not, for a period of twelve months following the termination of employment with the Company, work for or be engaged by, or otherwise be involved
	with (in any capacity), any material competitors, suppliers, customers or partners of the Company, whose business is wholly or partly similar to the businesses in which you were materially involved within the 2 years prior to termination, without
	the prior written consent of the Company. Such consent, however, will not be unreasonably withheld.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You agree that the time limitation and the restrictions as described in this section are fair and reasonable and will not unreasonably interfere with your
	ability to make a living.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You shall not, at any time during employment, or after termination for one year, directly or indirectly solicit, hire or entice any employee away from Birds
	Eye Limited.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Each of the obligations contained in the covenants as set out above is an entirely separate and independent restriction on you, despite the fact that it may
	be contained in the same phrase or sub-clause, and if any part is found to be unenforceable the remainder will remain valid and enforceable. The restrictions are considered by you and the Company to be reasonable, but in the event that any such
	restriction is held to be void or ineffective but would be valid and effective if some part thereof were deleted, such restriction shall apply with such modification as may be necessary to make if valid and effective.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	20.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Intellectual Property
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	You acknowledge that if, at any time during the course of your duties or employment, you make, discover or participate in the making or discovery of any
	invention whether being capable of being patented or not, or of any design or work to which copyright attaches, the Company is entitled to the benefit of such intellectual property and you shall immediately notify the Company of this occurrence.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Without further consideration, you shall, at the request and expense of the Company, both while employed and thereafter, give and supply such information,
	data, drawings and assistance as may be requisite to enable the Company to exploit the intellectual property to its best advantage and shall execute all documents and do all that is necessary or desirable in respect of obtaining patents or other
	protection for the intellectual property and for vesting the same in Birds Eye Limited, or as the Company may direct.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage170"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Data Protection
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	By signing these Terms &amp; Conditions of Employment you agree to the Company
	holding and processing, both electronically and manually, the data it collects in relation to you. This will be done for the purposes of the administration and management of its employees and for compliance with applicable procedures, laws and
	regulations, storage and processing by the Company or the Company&#146;s agent of the data outside of the European economic area to Countries which may not have Data Protection laws in place.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	22.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Conflicts of Interest
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During your employment with the Company you must not,
	except with the prior written permission of your manager, belong to or have any financial interest in any business or organisation which gives rise or may give rise to a conflict of interest. You must notify your manager as soon as possible if you
	become aware that such a conflict exists or may exist or if there is any potential for a conflict interest arising.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	23.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Breaches
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In the event of a breach of any of the agreements or undertakings on
	your part herein contained the Company shall be entitled to recover as part of its damages all loss and damage sustained or suffered by any of its Associated Companies so far as the same are not recoverable by such companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	24.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Entire Agreement
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	These Terms &amp; Conditions of Employment combined with the offer letter,
	supersede all prior agreements, understandings and arrangements, both verbal and written between you and the Company and constitutes the entire agreement between you and the Company in respect of the subjects described.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company reserves the right at its sole discretion to make changes to
	these Terms &amp; Conditions of Employment. You will be given at least one month&#146;s notice of any change.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Dear Tania,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Further to recent discussions I am pleased to confirm the following alterations to your terms and conditions:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	With effect from today your notice period is extended from 3months to 6months. For the avoidance of doubt your employment may now only
	be terminated by either you or by the Company through giving 6 months written notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company will extend to you again in
	2008 the entitlement to be eligible for a conditional award of up to 100% of salary, subject to performance, to recognise the importance of a successful IT implementation. From 2009 onwards you will revert to the prevailing company variable pay
	scheme which offers an incentive of 45% of salary for target company performance rising to a maximum of 75% for stretch performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Please can I ask you to sign a copy of this letter as acceptance to these changes in terms and conditions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Can I
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
<I>
</I>
	take this opportunity to thank you again for the tremendous energy, drive and leadership you are
	demonstrating in Pioneer. I appreciate the next few months will be very challenging both personally and professionally but I
<I>
</I>
	remain hugely confident in our ability to finally separate fully from Unilever!
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Yours sincerely
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/01/0001193125-16-527793_G171646EX49P7B.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>

	Martin Glenn
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT:13%; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
